text: An UGLY MAN charges through on a horse, holding a lantern forward on a long pole. He looks back, terrified.

1799 Sleepy Hollow, New York THUNDEROUS HOOFBEATS are HEARD behind. The ugly man glances back again.  His lantern swings wild SHATTERS against a tree.  The jammed-up pole SLAMS the ug man off his horse... He hits the ground.  He runs, trips, falls and scrambles DEEP IN THE FOREST, we glimpse the source of the HOOFBEAT HUGE FORM on a HUGE BLACK HORSE, already gone. The ugly man pushes through thorny bushes.  Jagged branch slit his hands and cheeks. He bursts from the briar patch and tumbles to a trail.  H lifts his bloodied face.  He runs. IN THE FOREST BEHIND: the hooves of the black horse rip underbrush.  HOOFBEATS DEAFENING.  A spur digs into the snorting steed's already bleeding flank. The pursuer's gloved hand draws a SWORD, blade RINGING. ON THE TRAIL, the ugly man runs on.  The shrill WHISTLE o SWORD SWING is HEARD as the pursuer blurs past. The ugly man is still running when his head lolls back, a impossible angle... tumbles off his shoulders... His head body hits the dirt.
Empty cobblestone streets.  Crooked buildings.  A RAPIDLY CLANGING BELL breaks the silence from afar.

New York City TWO CONSTABLES clamor round a corner, lanterns held high, listening.  They rush into an alleyway. ELSEWHERE, piers border the Hudson River.  The BELL is LOUDER. The two constables arrive, searching.  No one aro Constable One hefts his pistol, scared.
Where are you?! MAN'S VOICE (o.s.)
Here!  Over here! They hurry to the river's edge.  Down a hill, the MAN, another constable, stands with his back to us.  He's wais deep in water, tossing away his ALARM BELL.
I need your help with this. Constable Two crosses on the peir above.  Constable One m forward, wary.  The MAN grunts, lifting something.
Constable Crane?  Ichabod Crane... is that you? The MAN turns.  Meet ICHABOD CRANE, handsome, eyes pierci
Yes, it is me.  But, not only me... (lifting, struggling)
I found someone here... He drags a bloated MALE CORPSE up from the murky water.
Someone quite dead.
The elderly HIGH CONSTABLE lifts a blanket off the corpse a wheelbarrow manned by Constable Two.  A snobby MAGISTRA looks, disgusted.  Constable One and Ichabod wait.
Burn it.
Yes, sir. Constable Two wheels the corpse inside.  Ichabod's dismay
Just a moment... if I may.  It is possible this man was murdered.
He drowned.  Anyone could see.
There are surgical ways of telling how he died... by the water in his lungs... Ichabod follows the High Constable and Magistrate in.
Constable Two wheels the body ahead past many "booking" tables.  A JAILER moves to unlock a massive door.
He will be burned pursuant to statutes of health.
I could determine if he were dead before he went into the Hudson.
Must we again hear these heretical rantings?
Yes, must we?

There is nothing heretical about science, sir.  The Chinese have written on it for hundreds of years... procedural study used to solve seemingly unsolvable crimes. The door is opened.  The corpse again leads the way.
A two-tiered prison, alive with MOANS of AGONY and CRIES INSANITY.  Cells are full of wretched men in chains and i gags.  Many are against the bars, watching.

Our first night watch is adequate against fire and some violence, but if we were more often able to ensure justice, after the fact, then criminals would truly have something to fear from law enforcement.
Have they nothing to fear presently?
Without disrespect, look around you. (motioning to cells)
We overflow.  As do our courts.
And,  with disrespect, Constable, if jails and courts overflow, it is testimony to success, not failure.

But, how many innocents rot here? And, how many victims are buried without reprisal while guilty men roam our streets? The High Constable reaches a desk, taking a seat.  Guards wait to process beaten, bloody prisoners.
Very few, if any.
Even though I have seen confessions pried from the lips of the accused, often quite literally?
For one who calls himself a Federalist, your mouth reeks of Republican liberalism.
Not Liberalism.  Equanimity.
(to High Constable)

Um, sir... might I suggest... The Magistrate WHISPERS in the High Constable's ear.  Ich notices with worry that Constables One and Two wheel the corpse onwards into another room. The Magistrate finishes.  The High Constable smiles faint
(to Ichabod)

There is a farming community upstate, Constable... ten days journey north in the Hudson Highlands.  It is named Sleepy Hollow.  Within a fortnight, three persons have been murdered there. Each with their head lopped cleanly off. (holds up papers)
The elders of the Hollow have sent dispatches to me, requesting assistance, and now, just this very moment, I have chosen you.
Chosen me?
These "methods" of yours... there has been no practical application.
Not for lack of trying.
Just so.  Granted.  And so you take your experimentations to Sleepy Hollow and catch the murderer who has tainted the place.  Bring him here to face our good justice. Will you do this for me?
(swallowing doubt)
I shall, gladly.
Excellent.  Then, you are excused till morning. Ichabod moves away, heading to where the corpse was taken
Oh, and, Constable... (off Ichabod's look)
Do make certain that you meet with success.  Otherwise... perhaps you should not come back at all. The High Constable smiles a sardonic smile.
The corpse burns in a raging furnace.  Flesh sizzles. Constable One pumps bellows which fan the flames.  Ichabo steps from darkness nearby.  He watches with bitter regre the corpse is consumed.
Market town streets bustle.  Filthy.  Pigs roam free.
Decorated in Early-American Mad Scientist: books, papers jars of chemicals.  Charts of anatomy above a small bed. ICHABOD (o.s.)

Such a day for such a sad farewell. But, this is goodbye, my sweet. At the window, Ichabod holds a bird cage with a red CARDI inside.  He opens the cage.  The bird flies free. Ichabod watches it go, then looks down.  A COACH halts in street below.  The forlorn DRIVER looks up.
In motion.  Ichabod absently studies his hands, touching strange SCARS on both palms: evenly dispersed, tiny dots tissue.  Many scars. Ichabod lifts a LEATHER SATCHEL, checking its contents.

TWO FAMILIES of MIGRANT WORKERS travel a path, leading ov burdened horses.  Ichabod's coach approaches from the oth direction.  Ichabod looks out, unnerved. One GAUNT MAN watches Ichabod pass.  There is a dead, wor look in the man's eyes.  Others stare at Ichabod.

location: SLEEPY HOLLOW, THE LONG STRAIGHT ROAD

text: Ichabod faces two massive, vine-covered PILLARS, unsure. turns to watch the driver lead the coach away. Ichabod walks between the pillars to a long straight road He does not notice, above: THREE DEAD RAVENS hang from a limb, twine wrapped round their necks.

Ichabod walks on with baggage.  The square is empty, a CH and GRAVEYARD at one end.  The road ahead is bordered by businesses and homes. CONVERSATION DRIFTS from a tavern.  A criminal sits in stocks.  A quiet CRYING is HEARD.  Ichabod hears... He looks for its source.  It's from a window above, LOUDE SOUNDS like the SOBBING of an OLD WOMAN.

: a BELLTOWER stands tall, like a mast pole with a crow's nest basket atop.  There's a man in the bas and a huge BELL. Ichabod ponders this as he continues.  Ahead on a hill: t grand Van Tassel Manor House.

location: VAN TASSEL MANOR HOUSE, SITTING ROOM

text: MANY CHILDREN, in a circle, taunt a BLINDFOLDED YOUNG WOM spun round by the handsome, barrel-chested man, BROM VAN BRUNT.  A few YOUNG MEN and LADIES watch.  Brom releases woman.  Everyone quiets and avoids her searching hands.
This is such a silly game.

Be a sport and stop complaining. The woman moves to Brom's voice.  He backs away, flanked peers GLENN and THEODORE.  Children laugh. Ichabod enters, clearing his throat.  No one notices.  Th blindfolded woman keeps grasping.  One LITTLE GIRL sees Ichabod and goes to him, finger to her lips.
Play along.  You must. She tugs him.  Before Ichabod can protest, he is placed i the blindfolded woman's grip.
There, I have someone.  Am I finished?
You have to tell who it is. The woman touches Ichabod's face.  He is uncomfortable, affected by this caress.  Brom watches jealously.
At least make a guess.
I don't know.  Is it Brom Bones?
Certainly not.
Excuse me, Miss... (takes her hands)
They have a laugh at your expense. She takes the kerchief off to reveal a stunning beauty: KATRINA VAN TASSEL.  Ichabod tries to compose himself.
Forgive me, I didn't know.
I... I am looking for Baltus Van Tassel.
We haven't heard your name yet, friend.
Well, unless your name is Baltus, you should not worry over mine. Brom grabs Ichabod's collar, pissed.  Ichabod's baffled.
You need some manners.
Brom! Brom looks at her, then reluctantly releases Ichabod. MAN'S VOICE (o.s.)
What is this, then... ? BALTUS VAN TASSEL, 45, has entered, a working-class aristocrat.  LADY VAN TASSEL, 40, stands behind, a mix of home-spun wife and well-kept lady.
Can I help you, sir? Ichabod's relieved to have a proper focal point.  Childre gather around Katrina and hide behind her.
I have been sent from the city with a letter of introduction. I am told you offer me room and board. Ichabod hands over papers.  Baltus reads, furrows his bro
If we could speak alone.
(nods, looks to Katrina)
This is not a time for frivolity, Katrina, is it?  Am I mistaken?
They're only children, father. Baltus snorts, then exits with Ichabod.  The others huddl gossip, except Katrina, who moves beside Lady Van Tassel watch Ichabod and Baltus walk down the hall.

DOCTOR LANCASTER, 50, dour and always sweaty, takes a sea the fire, joining Baltus and three other elders.  A prett servant, SARAH, brings a pipe cradle while Lady Van Tasse sets down food.  Ichabod is standing.
That will be all, ladies. (waits as they exit)

We are joined by Doctor Thomas Lancaster, Constable.  And to his left are, Clergyman Steenwyck and our able magistrate, Samuel Philipse, both keeping order in their own ways. PHILIPSE is youngest, eyes bloodshot, mug in hand and pip mouth.  CLERGYMAN STEENWYCK is formidably built, wearing constant look of disapproval.

I myself am in charge of financial matters and the regulation of currency in our commonwealth.  And, lastly, this fine fellow is James Hardenbrook, our Notary. HARDENBROOK is oldest, ancient, with one eye pale and bli
An honor, gentlemen.  In time I will need every detail of the three murderings you've had, but, for now, I ask only if you have any theory at all as to who the killer might be?
Excuse me?
I say, is there any one person suspect in these acts?
I was afraid of this. Philipse shoots a look to Baltus.  Angst amongst the elde
Well, Constable... are you aware... to be honest, you are not what we expected.  We sent for the militia.
The militia?
Why not tell us what you have heard? Hmm?  How much have your superiors bothered to tell you?
All I know is three are slain, their heads found severed from their bodies...
The heads were not found severed. The heads were not found at all. Withered Hardenbrook leans forward, his voice cragged.
Taken.  Taken by the Headless Horseman.  Taken back to hell.
Pardon me?
You have not been well informed of our troubles, sir.  If you would... Baltus gestures for Ichabod to sit.  Baltus lights his pi

The Horseman... he was a Hessian mercenary, sent to our shores by German princes to help keep Americans under the thumb of England.  However, unlike his compatriots who came as muscle in trade for currency, he came willingly.  For love of carnage.
The HESSIAN HORSEMAN rides his black steed into a gory, close-quarters clash, his cloaked uniform adorned with ed weapons.  He cuts down Americans left and right. BALTUS (v.o.)

He was infamous for taking his horse, Daredevil, hard into battle... chopping off heads at full gallop. He dismounts, hoisting a battle axe.  With sword and axe, annihilates.  Blood gushes.  Bones crack. BALTUS (v.o.)
Just to look on him made your blood run cold, for he had filed down his teeth to rapiers... to add to the ferocity of his appearance. The Horseman lets out a war cry.  Jagged teeth.  Grotesqu
Winter.  CANNONS can be HEARD BOOMING from afar.  Daredev lies dead in red snow.  FOLLOW FOOTPRINTS away... BALTUS (v.o.)

He would not finally meet his end till the winter of seventy-nine, when New York City was held by Henry Clinton and Washington occupied West Point.  It was between those two places, not far from here... The Horseman flees, cloak flowing, chased by FIVE rag-tag REVOLUTIONARY SOLDIERS.  Ahead, a steep, rocky area preve escape.  Soldier one aims a rifle and FIRES... Blood explodes from the Horseman's arm as he runs.  His s falls from his now functionless hand. Soldier Two grabs the sword. At the rocks, the Horseman faces the men.  Another Riflem raises his rifle.  The Horseman reaches over his shoulder grasp a sheathed knife, THROWS -- THOCK!  The Rifleman jerks back, knife in his eye socket. The Horseman readies an axe.  The Revolutionaries move in with swords.  They battle, STEEL AGAINST STEEL.  The Hors fends off blows from all sides. Soldier Three lunges, stabs his blade deep into the Horseman's side.  The Horseman roars, brings his axe DOWN BREAKS the sword at the hilt... An UPWARDS stroke sends Soldier Three head over heels in fountain of blood. The Horseman staggers, howling, trying to pull the blade his ribs.  The remaining soldiers close in.
Pipe smoke wafts from Philipse's mouth.
Cut off his head with his own sword. It's a legend told for twenty years.
But, only recently has the Headless Hessian been seen prowling the Hollow, in search of a head to suit his shoulders.
Just a moment... (sits back, incredulous)
Are you saying it is he?
(aggravated, loud)

When a goblin leaps from the nether world, others follow.  Poltergeists of the air, water and earth follow and cheer his desecrations! Hardenbrook BANGS his cane on a table.  Baltus puts a cal hand on senile Hardenbrook's shoulder.
No one knows why he chose to now to climb out from his grave.
It is very clear why.  Citizens here have long tried to hide sins behind closed doors.  Their failed faith has saturated the soil and called forth one of Satan's own.
Excuse me, gentlemen, but... who has seen this Horseman?
Many have.
Then, name one person who has seen him with their own eyes. A long wait.  No reply from the elders.  Ichabod rises.
While I will do everything I can to find your assassin, I will look for a man of flesh and blood.  Not some goblin-demon from hell.
The Belltower is covered in defensive spikes.  A man clim down a rope ladder.  Below, many ARMED MEN gather.  Every grim.  Philipse moves to the center, on horseback.

Gather round!  Gather and quiet! The hour has come to choose for this night.  Each man's name is in this box and has been checked. A box is handed up.  Ichabod and Baltus arrive on foot at back of the mob.  Ichabod looks... At a nearby forest, men light TORCH POSTS in a line borde the forest edge for at least a half mile. Philipse draws a folded paper from the box, holds it up.
May the Lord watch over him... (unfolds paper)
"Jonathan Masbath."  Are you here? JONATHAN (o.s.)
I am.  I take my responsibility. The crowd parts as JONATHAN MASBATH, a dirt-poor farmer w a bow and quiver of arrows, moves forward.  His son, YOUN MASBATH, 14, grips his arm.
No, father.  Wait... (up to Philipse)
He's already been up once.  Why does he go again?
It is a lottery, son.  It just as easily might have been one of them.
Then... I go with you.
No.  You obey my wishes. (looks to crowd)
Brom.  Look after him, will you? Brom steps up, nodding.  Jonathan kisses his son's cheek, then heads to the rope ladder.  Men pat him on the back.
Someone leave him a horse. Young Masbath watches his father go.  Brom coaxes him awa At the back of the crowd, Ichabod watches skeptically, lo to Young Masbath as he and Brom pass.
You worry for naught, little man. Nothing will harm him there. (looks up, sotto)
It is problems here on the ground you people need begin to worry about. Ichabod watches Jonathan climb, very high above.
Ichabod makes notations in a LEDGER BOOK. KATRINA (v.o.)
You will dream. Katrina strolls in, sits on the bed.  Ichabod is nervous.

Did they tell?  It is something in the air so that dreams come to everyone.  According to the elders, an Indian prophet held powwows here before the land was taken, and spells cast then still linger to this day.
Do you often make a habit of sitting on strange men's beds?
You are horribly old-fashioned, aren't you?
Feel free to form your own opinion. (facing his ledger)
Though it appears you already have.
Well, I intended to apologize for the behavior of my friend Brom Van Brunt, but it seems I've made matters worse. (getting up to go)
I'll leave you to your business.
Excuse me... I should apologize.  I, um... I... have no great love of...
Other people?
Small talk.
It might have been more.  Might have been positively grand talk. Ichabod offers his chair, backing away.  Seeing it is the only one, he remains standing.  Katrina sits.
Is it me, or are you this nervous around all women?
Perhaps it is because your suitor's hands were recently very nearly wrapped around my throat.
My suitor?
The massive fellow... Brom.  For someone you call "friend," he misplaces a good portion of jealousy.
He has proposed to me twice.
Which may explain his temperament. To have asked twice means the answer was "no" at least once. Katrina looks down, discards this with a smile.
I've read a great deal about your New York City.  Do be a dear and tell me all about it.  Sounds like an extraordinary place to live a life.
Extra ordinary, yes.  But first, you tell me about the Headless Horseman.

The torches burn bright.  ABOVE, in the Belltower, Jonath Masbath loads a rifle.  THUNDER BOOMS. Jonathan stands, looking to a sky that is all stars and m A HORSE is HEARD SHRIEKING.  Below, the horse tied at the base of the tower is spooked. A COMMOTION is HEARD, ground rumbling.  Jonathan grips a rifle, cocks it and moves to look... At the forest edge, a herd of deer stampedes out.  They sprint past the tower and across the field. Jonathan crosses to watch the herd scatter.  He crosses b to peer at the forest.  Bad news... A thick FOG creeps from the woods. As the fog overtakes the base of each torch, a tentacle o mist snakes up to the flame, killing it.  All along the forest, arms of vapor snuff torches... one by one by one. Above, Jonathan sights the rifle along the trees.
Come out, devil... come....
Ichabod leans on a dresser.  Katrina's still seated.

Not all think it is the Horseman. Many say witches come from the Western Woods to steal skulls for their cauldrons.  Some believe a person in this very town kneels before Lucifer, offering death as tribute.  And, still others believe none of it.
Are you so superstitious?
To call a person superstitious is to imply they fear magic, but not all magic is black.
There is no such thing as magic.
Really?  Then... what is your rebuttal to those romantic poets claiming proof of magic in a rose at full bloom, or even in a teardrop?
Poets have silly notions about plants and bodily secretions.
(laughs)
You are funny. Ichabod doesn't get what's so funny about that.  The DIST TOLL of a BELL is HEARD.  Katrina looks fearful. She goes to open a window.  The BELL TOLLS...
... TOLLS mournfully over farms and forests...
... TOLLS as a MAN comes from his barn, listening, then sprinting towards his home.
... TOLLS across the deserted square.  Windows go dark. Shutters are slammed shut.
... TOLLS.  Ichabod bounds out to the lawn, halting to listen.  Katrina and Baltus come out on the porch.
Constable, where are you going!? ... TOLLS... TOLLS... then, SILENCE.  Ichabod chases away
Come back, sir... (watches him go)
Madness. Baltus ushers Katrina back in.  The door slams.
Ichabod charges across the rocky field.  He slows, awed.. The Belltower is down, its mast is splintered.  The horse gone.  Ichabod moves to where the crow's nest lies smashe No sign of Jonathan.

Jonathan runs past, gripping his bow.  It's QUIET... till HOOFBEATS are HEARD in pursuit. Trees are silhouetted against the sky.  As HOOFBEATS get LOUDER, branches bend like arms and fingers yearning to touch.  As HOOFBEATS ROAR PAST, the trees relax. FURTHER ON, Jonathan runs.  WIND begins to BLOW. BEHIND, in motion, WE SEE Daredevil's snorting visage; ey lizard-like, with vertical slits literally aglow. The Horseman's hand yanks a wooden WAR HAMMER from a sadd mount.  (No clear view of the Horseman.) HORSEMAN'S P.O.V. : closing in on Jonathan. Jonathan is overtaken.  The Horseman swings the hammer WH -- sends Jonathan sprawling. HOOFBEATS FADE.  Jonathan tries to get up, but pain shoot through him.  He crawls to retrieve his bow. Against a tree, he takes an arrow from his shoulder quive and readies it.  Waiting.  A metal TAPPING is HEARD O.S. CLINK... CLINK... CLINK.  A HORSE SNORTS. Jonathan pulls the bow taut, pained, lips bloody. Elsewhere, Daredevil approaches slow.  The Horseman taps sword on his spur, CLINK... CLINK... CLINK... Foliage moves as the Horseman's form pushes through. Jonathan releases -- the arrow WHISTLES... THWACK! -- imbeds in the Horseman's chest. CLINK... CLINK... CLINK... continues -- Jonathan readies second arrow.  Pulls and releases -- O.S. THWACK! CLINK... CLINK... CLINK... Jonathan cries out, crawling a desperately.  Crawling through underbrush, over roots and rocks.  CLINK... CLINK... CLINK... Jonathan gives up, spe face to the dirt.  He closes his eyes. CLINKING STOPS.  Daredevil halts astride Jonathan; two le on each side of Jonathan's body.
Baltus and a large, DULLARDLY MAN ride.  Behind, Ichabod rides with Magistrate Philipse. Ichabod is not adept at riding his old nag, Gunpowder.
The Van Garretts died first; a man and his son, survived by a wife and two infants.  And the Widow Windsor was next...
And now Jonathan Masbath.
(looks back, ponders)
Why would he flee this direction, with so much open ground to cross before he reached cover?
He would not have gone into the Western Woods.  No sane man would. Philipse drinks from a whiskey flask, sees Ichabod watchi and offers some.  Ichabod declines.
Van Ripper there... Ahead, the dullard, VAN RIPPER, sloppily spits tobacco.
... found the body this morning. (pause)
You do believe now, don't you?
Believe?
You said yourself.  What mere man could have downed the Belltower?
It is a prime tenet of science, Philipse, that because one thing appears improbable does not mean you embrace the utterly fantastical.
You need less big words, and more common sense. Philipse fingers an IRON KEY talisman he wears on a cord.
What is that you wear?
My talisman.  It will, protect against the Horseman if I show a brave face.  But, I cannot run.  If I run in fear, it is worthless.
Well... so much for common sense.
Brom and Baltus stand at a HORSE'S CORPSE amongst jagged boulders.  The flesh has been stripped, guts exposed. Philipse and Ichabod arrive and dismount.
Was this Jonathan's?
Yes.  Seems he panicked across here and broke two legs.
Who took the meat?
Must have been the Redman.  A Lenape Indian lives in the Western Woods.
These woods of yours sound a bit crowded, what with all the witches, ghouls and Indians living there. Brom climbs up onto his own horse, a black beauty.

There's only one Lenape.  He eats small animals and lost children... and the occasional constable when he can get it. Brom rides.  Ichabod goes to the dead horse, digs in his satchel for a thin iron tool, which he uses it to pry off HORSESHOE.  A WHISTLE is HEARD O.S. Everyone looks far ahead to where Van Ripper has ridden. doctor and others are there.  Van Ripper waves.
Doctor Lancaster stands with SEVERAL ARMED MEN.  A coffin a cart is covered by a blanket. Ichabod is crouched nearb
Why did you move the body, Doctor?

To place it inside its coffin. Ichabod, nods, vaguely annoyed.  He puts the horseshoe in hoofprint in the dirt.  It fits. Ichabod rises, walks, studying the ground, kicking up lea Brom, Van Ripper, Baltus and Philipse watch. Ichabod finds a deep hoofprint.  Huge.  He compares the horseshoe.  The hoofprint is much larger. Ichabod pulls his satchel off his shoulder, takes out a b bottle of water and bag of brown powder; begins mixing wa and powder with a fork to make plaster. The others watch, finding this bizarre, whispering.  Brom comes up to stand over Ichabod, irritated.
What the hell are you doing?
(ignoring pause)
You are the blacksmith.  Ever shod a horse with a hoof this large?
Never.  A shoe that size I would have remembered. Ichabod starts to fill the print with plaster.
Van Ripper.  Can you show where the body lay?
I can show exactly. Van Ripper dismounts, wiping tobacco drool.  Ichabod rise follow with his satchel.
Here... in front of this oak, facing north.  Horrible...

To the best of your recollection, where did the open wound fall? Van Ripper points.  Ichabod takes a BOTTLE of WHITE POWDE from his pocket. He uncorks the bottle, cautiously pouring powder in an x the dirt there, then waiting. A chemical reaction causes the powder to bubble a bit.
There was not much blood, was there?

I didn't see none. Ichabod stands, puzzled.  He walks to the coffin cart, rolling up his sleeves.  Others come to watch, but keep distance.  Ichabod removes the blanket... Reveals Jonathan's headless corpse. Philipse can't look.  Ichabod takes strange spectacles fr his satchel; wire-framed with many lenses.  MAGNIFICATION SPECTACLES.  He examines the gross neck wound, sniffs it. He pokes the flesh and severed spinal cord.
No bleeding.
What is that?
This should have bled by the pint. Yet, no blistering or scorched flesh. How... ?  Whatever weapon was used... it cauterized somehow.... Ichabod straightens, eyes weirdly big in the spectacles.
It instantly burnt the wound shut.

A coffin in a grave.  Headstone reads "MASBATH, 1799."  A CROWD gathered.  Young Masbath broods.  Clergyman Steenwy steps forward to take a handful of newly dug dirt. Men with guns stand at the outskirts, like on guard. Steenwyck sprinkles dirt into the grave with prayerful wo In the crowd people whisper.  They steal glances at Ichab who stands with the Van Tassels.

Dining room.  Sarah and two other servants collect plates few people still sup, including Van Ripper, his warty WIF and two kids.  Van Ripper guzzles ale, laughs at somethin his also-drunk wife says. IN the HALL and FOYER, funeral goers socialize quietly. FURTHER ON, in the SITTING ROOM, men smoke.  Young Masbat is confronting Ichabod, who is leaving...
I am not here for revenge.  I am here to bring justice.
Whatever.  You still need a second to tend to your things.
I manage fine alone.
I deserve to help you.  Don't you see how much this means?  My father... he... he was a good man...
(faces Masbath)
Young Masbath, I am sorry for your loss.  It is a great and sad tragedy. However... I cannot be the one to look after you now.
(angry)
I did not ask you to, did I? Young Masbath exits.  Ichabod remains impassive.
Ichabod comes out.  KILLIAN, a dashingly rustic man, carr his son, THOMAS, 5, and chats with Baltus.  Doctor Lancas peers off at something through a SPYGLASS.
Hail, Constable.  How are you?
Well enough.  Your gathering does honor to the deceased.
(still using spyglass)
We must be a curious sight to him.
What are you spying on?
(offers the spyglass)
The Lenape.  He comes to gawk at civilization from time to time.
Searching a line of trees and foliage far away... DOCTOR LANCASTER (o.s.)
Do you see the Redskinned bastard? There he is -- the LENAPE.  A towering savage with missha features covered in tumors.  He ducks away.
Ichabod lowers the spyglass, a little awed.
He is a behemoth.
A diseased monster.
If you gentlemen will excuse the doctor and I... we have financial matters to discuss. Ichabod and Killian nod as Baltus and Lancaster head in.
Master Crane, sir.  I'm glad we have time alone.  You've been told plenty about the Horseman, I'm certain.
More than enough, actually.  (tired laugh)
I beg you, no more, please.
No, sir, no.  If you ask me, I say you just laid eyes on our murderer through that glass. Ichabod ponders, folding the spyglass.
Tell me something.  (pause)
What becomes of Young Masbath?

Van Ripper and his wife agreed to take him.  They have children and a good home and good land. Ichabod nods.  He turns to look THROUGH THE WINDOW.  In t DINING ROOM, Van Ripper rises, ill.  His wife questions h health, but he holds her off and vomits. Ichabod notes this with a deep sigh.
Ocher dusk.  Ichabod rides to Young Masbath, seated on th ground, miserable.  Young Masbath does not look up.
Find yourself a place in the servants' residence and wake me before dawn. Our first task will be an unsavory one. Ichabod rides.  Young Masbath runs to his horse and follo
Steenwyck is on horseback, looking down at Ichabod, furio
It is sacrilege!
I cannot proceed without examining the previous victims. Steenwyck looks to men with shovels.  Killian's there. Philipse, hung-over, stands beside Young Masbath.
Magistrate Philipse, surely you can stop this. Philipse just looks up with a helpless expression.
I will not allow it.  I will not!
Protest to my superiors if you like.
Your superiors are two days away!

Then, you should have left two days ago, because I have men willing to help me today. Ichabod motions.  Killian leads the men to the graveyard. Steenwyck watches, enraged.  He kicks his horse and rides Philipse looks worried.

A PSALM is HEARD READ by STEENWYCK O.S. while a coffin is exhumed.  Ichabod guides the lifting.  The coffin is put the headstone "WINDSOR."  Ichabod looks... At the church, Steenwyck faces about fifty people who now take up the PRAYER. Across the cemetery, two coffins, one small, one large, a pried open.  "VAN GARRETT, 1799."  Killian leads the effo with Young Masbath's aid... The lids come off, revealing the HEADLESS BODIES of a MAN a little BOY.  Young Masbath backs away. At the "WINDSOR" coffin, nails creak as Ichabod opens the lid.  WE DO NOT SEE inside, but when Ichabod does, he is aghast.  He looks to the men, angry.
Why was I not told of this? No answer.  Killian arrives, nods solemnly.
The Widow Windsor.
Is that all you say?  Look at her.

It's not something people speak of openly.  She did not remarry. Ichabod kneels, studying.  Now, WE SEE: the belly of the headless corpse is bulbous, because the Widow Windsor was very far along in a pregnancy. Ichabod notices: a tear in the cloth of widow's blouse. reaches through the tear, feeling the stomach. He straightens, greatly troubled.

Scissors cut open the widow's blouse.  There's an inch-lo WOUND on the moldering belly; a sword puncture. Ichabod examines the corpse on a table.  Lancaster watche anxiously mopping his face.  Young Masbath's in a corner. Ichabod goes to write in his ledger full of notes.
What is the common thread between these victims?
I'm sure I don't know.
We must discover it.  The reason the murderer chose these persons. Ichabod goes to look at the widow's corpse, pondering.
The wounds are the same.  Cauterized. No chopping or half-measures either. One stroke took the head.  Have you seen, doctor... ? (pointing to it)
Even the spinal bone... sliced as smooth as butter.
I do not care.  You are welcome to use my work area, but I beg you... return her to her resting place.
In time, doctor.  Soon as I finish. Ichabod picks up an iron knife.  He looks to Young Masbat
You should step outside.
Ichabod and others restore graves.  Ichabod looks to the church, where Clergyman Steenwyck stands in the door.
The devil sent you, Ichabod Crane. The Lord will not forgive your sins. Steenwyck shuts the creaky doors.
Ichabod sleeps, dreaming...
A young BOY, 10, stands in a wheat field with his back to A FEMALE VOICE is HEARD FAINTLY, getting LOUDER.
Ichabod!  Ichabod... come along. The boy, YOUNG ICHABOD, turns, smiling.  He runs.  We FOL to a clearing behind a frontier home.  MOTHER waits.  Lov woman.  She kisses him.

Dark.  Young Ichabod, in bed, has one eye open.  Across t room, Mother has her back to him.  She's WHISPERING somet to no one.  She turns... Young Ichabod pretends he is asleep. A DRAWER is HEARD SHUTTING.  Mother exits.  Ichabod gets curious, opens a drawer... finds something behind clothin It's a piece of reed grass, woven into an elaborate patte with shafts of wheat twisted into the center.  Young Icha replaces it, closes the drawer.

A busy, muddy street lined by wares and produce.  Young Ichabod walks with FATHER, an emotionless man.  Father st to examine tools.  Young Ichabod stays by him, but someth captures his attention... Across the way, Mother is involved in a argument with a FREAKISH-LOOKING WOMAN.  They shout.  People stop to watc Can't make out words, but Freakish Woman is furious.
LIGHTNING flashes over tree tops.  THUNDER BOOMS.
Ichabod jerks awake in his bed.
Ichabod enters with a lantern and his ledger.  He sits, studies notes, then notices there's a light down the hall
Opposite an elaborate loom, Katrina reads by candlelight. She looks up, seeing Ichabod enter.
Sorry for disturbing you.  I thought a forgotten candle was burning. Katrina self-consciously closes her shabby book, puts it another on her lap and covers them.
You do not disturb me.  Please stay. Having trouble sleeping?
May I ask... why do you cover your book that way?
You pay great attention to small things.  I hide these as I hide all my books.  Father would not approve, lest it were the Bible.
I, um... I have something to show you, if you have a moment. Ichabod sits, looking through his ledger.
These are strange... may I? She takes his hand, spreads the fingers to the palm.  She touches the many evenly spaced scars.
These scars.  How did you get them?
I have had them since childhood.  I cannot remember what from.
It would be interesting to find out. Their eyes meet.  Ichabod gets back to the ledger.  Katri seems to relish the effect she has.  Ichabod finds a pape disk on string, illustrated thusly:
Here it is.  A bird on one side. His cage on the other.  Now, stare at it.  (spinning it)
The bird seems to be in his cage.
Yes, he does.  May I try? Ichabod gives it.  She spins it, smiling.
He only appears to be inside the cage.  The point being...
You made this, and the drawings?
Yes, but listen.  The illusion is easily explained.  The eye retains each image, till they combine.  And yet, some would call this toy magic.
Don't you see why?  Look closely a moment.  Put your intellect aside.  (spinning it)
Can't you see what is inexplicable? Ichabod watches it spin.  He shakes his head, unimpressed
Oh, you are hopeless.  May I keep it at least?
If you want.  But...
Then, I also have a gift for you. True magic which even you will not be able to deny. She hands him a book.  "ROMEO AND JULIET."  Ichabod stand offering it back, but she will not take it.
Thank you.  No.  Here...
I insist that you have it.
(resigned, leaving)
Very well.  But, it will only sit gathering dust.
That would be a pity.  Those words might show you something you've never seen before. Ichabod stops at the door, looks back.  He exits.
A light glows in Ichabod's window.  LOOKING IN: Ichabod's bed, fully dressed.  He sits up.  Pause.  He crosses to p up "Romeo and Juliet."  He begins to read.
Ichabod walks with Philipse.  Young Masbath follows with horses.  CICADAS CHATTER from a vast corn field.
Not more than a year ago, a mob hung a man for stealing a horse.  For stealing a horse!  And, you dig up our dead.
Are you saying I should be frightened? Is this a message passed on from Clergyman Steenwyck? The CICADAS SUDDENLY go SILENT.  Young Masbath notices.
We are farmers here, not lawyers or bankers, or even constables.  Every penny we earn comes from what we send down the Hudson.
I know it.
Um.... excuse me, sirs...
(still to Ichabod)

Because of the Horseman, our migrant workers flee for their lives.  There is a danger that our crops will rot. So, if you are going to help us, you stop the Horseman.  That is your task... to kill an undead thing. Young Masbath looks to a fenced grazing area, worried.  T sheep there are agitated, all running one direction away.
Listen to what you say....
No, you listen!  You may think we are a pack of superstitious dullards...
At times I do.
Sirs... please!

What will it take for you to realize this is no laughing matter? The horses go crazy, braying and rearing.  The reins yank Young Masbath off his feet as the horses flee. Ichabod and Philipse look to Masbath.  A SOUND is HEARD, distant: THUNDERING HOOFBEATS.  Wind kicks up.  HOOFBEATS seem to come FROM ALL DIRECTIONS. Philipse looks to the corn field.  A flock of birds aligh a great sheet of black against the sky.

Oh my... oh my oh my oh my... Philipse runs towards his house, past Masbath.  HOOFBEATS LOUDER, CLOSER.  Ichabod faces the corn field. The field explodes open, stalks bending to make way as th Headless Horseman gallops into view atop Daredevil. Young Masbath runs, following Philipse. Ichabod's stunned.  He looks down to draw his flintlock pistol, but the Horseman blows by before he can raise it. blast of air knocks Ichabod off his feet. The Horseman chases Masbath and Philipse. Ichabod follows. The Horseman draws his sword. Young Masbath falls in the grass... Daredevil's pounding hooves will certainly crush him. Daredevil leaps over Young Masbath, continuing the charge Philipse has a long way to go before home.  He looks over shoulder.  No way he'll make it. Ichabod, running, watches Philipse slow. Philipse gathers all his courage and stops, turning.  The Horseman is closing, sword held high. Philipse raises his talisman.

Philipse! Philipse holds the talisman up, trying to be fearless.  T Horseman swings -- WE HEAR the CLANK of sword on talisman Philipse's severed head spins.  His body falls and folds. Ichabod runs past Young Masbath. The Horseman halts just as Ichabod reaches a point in fro of dead Philipse, aiming his pistol.  Daredevil lets out SCREECHY CRY.  The Horseman rides toward Ichabod. Ichabod gets on one knee, trying to steady his pistol.  T Horseman closes.  Ichabod sweats bullets.  FIRES... The slug SLAMS the Horseman dead center -- bursts through rends his uniform without slowing him. The Horseman is almost on Ichabod.  Ichabod cringes, arms up... as the Horseman passes. The Horseman leans to skewer Philipse's head with his swo With the head as his prize, the Horseman races away. Ichabod gets up, watches the Horseman head to the forest. Ichabod looks to Young Masbath, finds his legs will not support him, falls, trembling.  THUNDER BELLOWS.

location: VAN TASSEL HOUSE, SECOND FLOOR HALL

text: Lady Van Tassel comes to a door, knocks.  Sarah stands be with a tray of food.  Young Masbath is seated near.
(to Young Masbath)
Has he not come out at all? Young Masbath shakes his head.
KNOCKING is HEARD.  Ichabod sleeps restlessly.
THUNDER BOOMS.  WIND and POUNDING RAIN blast open a windo Mother comes to it, then moves to comfort fearful Young Ichabod in bed. MOTHER'S VOICE (v.o.)
Don't be afraid... don't be afraid.
A keyhole.  Young Ichabod's eye peers in...
Mother is kneeled before flour on the floor.  She draws patterns in it, whispering.  She blows the flour away.

The Freakish Woman (who argued with Mother) walks towards home, supported by a SAD MAN.  She weeps, carrying someth in a blanket. Young Ichabod comes a window, watching, scared. The Freakish Woman is so weak that she falls.  The blanke opens... the corpse of an infant tumbles to the dirt.  Th Freakish Woman's WAILING GROWS LOUDER.
TWO MEN in black drag Mother to a coach.  She looks back, fearful, pulled along.  A THIRD MAN in black follows. Young Ichabod struggles as Father restrains him.
No... mother... no... ! The Third Man peers back, a gray-haired, Cotton Mather-is man with a villainous face. FREAKISH WOMAN (v.o.)
The night of the great storm, I saw her cross my windows.
Many people in the gallery.  The Third Man stands in fron the tearful Freakish Woman in the witness box.
You are certain it was she?
In the lighting, I did see her. (points)
Her.  Lady Crane... Mother sits in shackles.
I will never forget.  The next moment, I found my infant dead... with the blood welt on his breast. Those in attendance cry out at this.  Ichabod is seated beside Father, eyes filled with tears.
As before, a STORM RAGES.  Ichabod is in Mother's arms. FREAKISH WOMAN (v.o.)
The night of the great storm, I saw her cross my windows.
Don't be afraid...
KNOCKING is HEARD.  Ichabod gasps awake. KATRINA (o.s.)
Constable Crane? Ichabod looks at his hands balled into fists.  He opens t -- has ONE HALF of PHILIPSE'S TALISMAN in each palm.

location: VAN TASSEL HOUSE, SECOND FLOOR HALLWAY

text: Katrina holds a tray of food.  The DOOR is HEARD UNLOCKIN
Katrina enters.  Ichabod sits at his work table.
Are you hungry? Ichabod shakes his head, won't look up.  Katrina crosses. She begins picking up pieces of the PLASTER HOOFPRINT CAS which lies shattered on the floor.
You promised justice.
If these are the random stalkings of a monster, what good am I?
People have put their trust in you.
They have done nothing of the sort.
Won't they still have that justice? (patience waning)
Or, was it a vain promise? Ichabod stews, head in his hands.  Someone is HEARD RUNNING... Young Masbath enters, frightened.
Constable Crane... something has happened.
The Lenape Indian hangs dead in a tree, lynched.  TOWNSFO are gathered.  Ichabod makes his way through, followed by Young Masbath, looking up. BROM (o.s.)
We do not need you, Constable... Brom strides towards Ichabod from a group of men spreadin sheet under the tree.  Van Ripper's there.
The men who did this have been taken. We do not need you here. Brom points to where TWO FILTHY MEN in chains sit in a horse-drawn cart.  An armed man guards them.
You should thank us.  The killings will end.  We saved you all! The armed man shoves the filthy man to shut him up.
They spend two days in chains.
Two days... ?  For murder?
For poaching.  Or, would you remake our laws now that Magistrate Philipse has given up the ghost?
Does that look like an animal hanging?

Looks like an Indian. Van Ripper cuts the noose rope at the trunk.  The Lenape corpse free falls, landing hard. The Lenape lies in a heap on the sheet.  Van Ripper and others come to lift the sheet with the Lenape in the midd Ichabod watches, noticing... The Lenape wears a WOVEN PIECE of REED GRASS a cord on hi loin cloth, twisted in a pattern.

Wait.  Give me a moment... Ichabod kneels.  He removes the woven piece, looking acro the diseased Lenape's body.  Something else... The Lenape's mouth is agape; teeth rotting.  Ichabod look around, finds a twig.  He uses it to pull the Lenape's mo open... gets close to peer inside the Lenape's mouth.
A DRAWING of the Lenape's WOVEN PIECE in Ichabod's ledger The piece lies near. Ichabod sits staring at it, trance-like.  Masbath waits. Long silence.
The Lenape Indian had much to tell once I opened his mouth.
How could he?
His teeth.  Someone had cut them and chipped off rotten pieces far back in his mouth.  The Lenape could not have done that for himself. (closes his journal)
Someone out there cared for him. Ichabod rises, deciding.  He picks up his satchel and exi Young Masbath is surprised.  He follows.
A massive, wooden WINDMILL, raised off the ground on a 7' center post.  Ichabod and Masbath walk to it.

Ichabod and Young Masbath enter via a ladder from the underbelly.  Gears and counter wheels turn millstones.  A men work in the grain powder filled air. Ichabod leads the way to a staircase, up twists and turns
Where are we going?
Up.
Ichabod and Young Masbath climb out a door to the roof. rotors spin nearby.  Ichabod searches the countryside. Below, MANY MEN are ride up the long straight road.
What is it?

It's payment day.  Loan monies are given to Baltus the last day each month.  Almost everyone borrows... for tools or to hire workers. Ichabod sits, takes a bowl from his bag and gives it to Masbath, then produces a bottle of water... fills the bow
(points)
Out there.  What do you see?
The Western Woods.
Look again. A plume of smoke rises from woods, far.
Smoke.  Chimney smoke. Ichabod holds a piece of straw in his mouth, rubs the poi of a sewing needle against a small BLACK ROCK.
Are you familiar with magnets?
What kind of nuts?
Not for eating, I assure you.  Watch here. Ichabod shows the magnet grab the needle.  Young Masbath amazed, reaching for it.  Ichabod watches him play with i
It's spectacular.
(smiles, pause)
Yes... I suppose it is.  Keep it.
No, I couldn't...
I have others.  All I need is this. Ichabod takes the needle, poking its butt end into the ti the straw.  Young Masbath studies the rock, pockets it.
Thank you.
(nods, almost shy)
Now, hold the bowl steady.  Back to business. Young Masbath lifts the bowl.  Ichabod drops in the needle/straw which floats and turns compass-like.
If the Western Woods are truly the Devil's Glen, we will see for ourselves.
(uneasy)
Father said witches live there.
Witches do not exist.  However... Ichabod uses a knife to notch the bowl lip where the need points, then surveys the smoke, making a second notch.
Not long ago, I would have said the same for Headless Horseman. KATRINA (o.s.)
Constable... ! Katrina's on horseback below, unhappy.
I need to speak with you.  Alone.
Ichabod and Katrina lead their horses.  A heated argument
Why would you do such a thing?
No stone may be left unturned.  It may appear harsh...
I have misjudged you I think.  I did not imagine you were so cruel.

You are not regarding it in full. The Widow Windsor had been run through by a sword.  I followed the bloodless wound, a wound whose path I could not comprehend till I had seen the Horseman with my own eyes.
What are you on about?
The child she carried was eight months grown at least... near to birthing.  The sword had pierced its tiny heart exactly.
Must I hear this?
There was no blind stabbing.  This singular thrust found its target omnipotently, as if the Horseman made certain the unborn child died with its mother.
And this gives worth to butchery?
It was not butchery.
What is it then?  Scientific method? How can any of this matter in the slightest?
I have no solution for its meaning yet, but I could not just ignore it.
Take a lesson from Young Masbath's desires, Ichabod Crane.  He follows with you to avenge his father's death. That I understand.  But, what do you want?
To avenge his father, and the others.
But, why?  Tell me why. Ichabod struggles for a reply.

You falter with your answer because you strive without putting the whole of your heart into it.  Can't you see? You'll bring dignity to the dead even if you have to chop them into little pieces to do it.
(fed up, growing anger)

If it had been surgery on a living person, done to save that person's life, you would not question it.  Not for a moment.  So, let me be the first to tell you, dear girl... on the other side of these sheltering mountains, a whole world has advanced beyond such plebeian thinking as yours.  And someday, no matter how much you fear it, that world will come to roust Sleepy Hollow out of its slumber. Katrina storms away.  Ichabod's already regretting.

Ichabod and Young Masbath ride to the Western Woods, hors loaded for expedition.  At the Belltower remnants, Ichabo slows, looking to the wreckage. At forest's edge, Young Masbath waits. Ichabod circles the tower.  With a sigh, he rides to join Young Masbath. They head into the woods.
Dark, dense and creepy.  Ichabod and Young Masbath move through.  Young Masbath halts his horse and looks around.
What is it?
Listen.
(listens, looks)
I hear nothing.
No crickets or cicadas calling.  No bird songs. Stark quiet.  Ichabod notes this unhappily.

Ichabod's hand drops the needle/straw in the water bowl. needle spins.  The bowl is turned to match notches. Ichabod points the way to Young Masbath. ELSEWHERE, SOMEONE WATCHES:  A MOVING P.O.V. WATCHES them they ride, FOLLOWS.
Ichabod and Masbath reach a hill crest.  They stop, uneas Below: a CAVE with a rock archway.  An ill-fitting door covers the mouth.  The chimney spews smoke.
We have apparently arrived.
The horses are tied to a tree.  Ichabod walks to the cave door.  Unsure, he hesitantly knocks.

Ichabod and Young Masbath step in. Walls are hung with skins and skeletons, dry flowers and grass in patterns.  An OLD CRONE sits facing away. The old Crone, a mountain woman with matted hair and grey features, sits disinterested.  Ichabod edges closer.
Pardon.  You did not answer when I knocked.  Are we intruding?
You are from the Hollow?
In a way, yes. Ichabod looks at tables of gourd bowls of dead insects an acorns.  Knifes, scissors, yellow bones.  He takes the Lenape's piece of reed grass from his pocket.
The Lenape who lived in these woods... do you know him?  The Redman? (uncomfortable wait)
I should tell you... he has been murdered.

Leave me.  You are not welcome here. The old Crone places something on a table beside her -- a dead cardinal, bright red. Ichabod is afraid, backing away, but Young Masbath takes woven piece and steps to the Crone.
Were you a friend to the Indian? (waits)
You should have this... if you were his friend. Young Masbath puts the woven piece beside the cardinal. walks to join Ichabod in leaving.
You seek remedy against the Horseman? The Old Crone reaches to pick up the weaving.  She stands faces them.  Tall.  Ichabod nods.
(to Young Masbath)
Go out and keep away, child. (to Ichabod)
You stay.  Follow with me. The Old Crone takes a candle and walks, deep into the cav
The Old Crone comes through a passage in the wet walls. Ichabod enters, scared, bent under low ceiling.
I hear him.  He rides to the Hollow and back.
The Horseman.  Yes.
Sit. Ichabod sits on crooked stool.  The old Crone kneels with back to him, gathers straw in a pile on the floor.
Can you help?
You want to see into the nether world... I can show you.  Whatever you see, do not move or speak.  I will hold him. She gathers bowls, putting grass and powder on the pile.
What... what are you doing?
(turns, furious)

Close your mouth!  Keep silent. She takes two jars from a table, pours ashes on the pile one.  She shakes the other roughly, takes the lid off and upends it.  A baby bat squirms on the floor, dazed. The Old Crone holds the bat, using a knife to cut off its head.  She soaks the straw with blood, SPEAKING IN TONGUE guttural.  Using a wick, she lights the straw. She grasps two METAL CUFFS with chains attached, slides t onto her bony wrists, then bends to inhale smoke.
He comes now. Ichabod would like to leave now.
Young Masbath, waiting by the horses, looks up.  Through trees, black clouds billow and block the sun.
The old Crone slumps, still with her back to Ichabod.  Sh does not move.  Wind howls through a hole/window.  Rain. Candles blow out.  Ichabod stands, worried.

Excuse me... um... She remains motionless.  The STORM outside intensifies. WE SEE the skin of the Crone's wrists transform; swelling the cuffs, hardening, cracking and bleeding. Some thing Ichabod cannot see.  He inches closer.

Are you alright... ? The Crone turns, hideous, leaping erect -- a half-human, half-demon CREATURE.  Its black clawed hands reaching. Ichabod recoils, crying out. Chains on restraining cuffs yank the creature back. Ichabod hits the floor, knocking over a table of bones. creature is chained, but still wants Ichabod.  It SCREECH The Old Crone's face seethes from transformation, eyes bl red, nostrils dripping, teeth now jagged.
You seek the warrior bathed in blood... the Headless Horseman. Ichabod slides back as far as possible while the creature claws the rock floor, yearning.
Follow the Indian trail to where the sun dies.  Follow to the tree of the dead. The creature pulls, testing the chains.  Behind, the BOLT holding the chains to the wall slips.  The wall cracks.

Climb down to the Horseman's soulless place and let loose his silent shrieking.  Do you hear?  Do you hear?! Ichabod nods, quaking, aghast.  He glances to the exit. The chain bolt gives more... coming loose...

He who holds fast the Horseman's desire will guide his reaping hand. Catch hold of his desire. Ichabod bolts for the door.  The creature HOWLS, leaping. The chain bolt breaks... Ichabod cries out, tackled to the floor... It is the Old Crone who landed on him.  She has returned human form, semi-conscious.  Ichabod shoves her off.
Ichabod runs out into the howling storm, past Masbath.
We are leaving.
What happened? Ichabod scrambles onto Gunpowder, heading further into th woods, glancing back.  Young Masbath follows.
No rain.  Dark.  A lantern's glow creates shifting shadow Ichabod and Young Masbath ride.
Follow the Indian trail to where the sun dies.  To the tree of the dead.  (looking back)
Maybe we passed it by.
How could something named "the tree of the dead" fail to draw attention? A BIRD CRIES OUT.  Ichabod's startled, looking up.  The B is HEARD ALIGHTING.  Leaves float downwards.
We should not go much further in this murk.
Should we go back?
We are far from the Hollow.  (dismounts, troubled)
Loath to say it... better to get our backs against a tree and stay till morning.

Horses are tied.  Ichabod is seated against a tree.  A campfire burns.  Young Masbath lies on a blanket, rifle c his chest, staring to treetops. Leaves and branches shift in the wind.  Bats fly wildly.
What does it mean... climb down to the Horseman's soulless place?
"Let loose his silent shrieking." Who knows, till we work at it?  I admit not being anxious to find out. (pause)
"He who holds the Horseman's desire will guide his reaping hand." Whatever the Horseman's desire is, other than extinguishing lives. A SNAPPING BRANCH.  Ichabod raises his pistol.
(to Young Masbath)

Do not move. Ichabod rises.  He creeps forward, pistol and lantern forward.  Foliage is thick.  CRUNCHING LEAVES are HEARD. Ichabod crouches, puts down the lantern and picks up a branch.  He tosses the branch to the foliage... SOME ANIMAL darts away, a running blur. Ichabod rises, following with his pistol.

low to the ground, moving swiftly at Ichabod... Ichabod spins, blindsided. Young Masbath fires his rifle -- CRACK!! The ANIMAL is KNOCKED DOWN mid-leap, yelping... The beast lands, a mass of grey fur. Ichabod comes to stare down.  Young Masbath arrives.  The both look to the beast, horrified. The creature lies helplessly spastic; a TWO-HEADED WOLF, one head blown open to brain and gore.  Its living head lifts, MEWING sadly, eyes pleading. Ichabod step up with pistol.  FIRES.  MEWING STOPS.
What God-forsaken hell is this? Ichabod swallows back sickness, looking away.  Something catches his eye.
Christ... Through the forest: the SKY'S LIT UP.  Distant fire.
Ichabod and Masbath ride up, confronted by the Crone's ca vomiting flame out all orifices. Ichabod approaches.  Embers swirl everywhere.  The Old Crone's body lies amongst bloodied leaves.  Headless.
Much commotion.  A MOB in front of the home marked "LANCASTER, PHYSICIAN."  Steenwyck addresses the rabble.

You all stand idle, while this man goes about with a book of secrets and a bag filled with magic.  You all stand idle, while the shadow of the Devil falls over our town. Baltus, Lady Van Tassel and Katrina watch at safe distanc
I say, if you do nothing, you share in the blasphemy of Ichabod Crane! Killian, on horseback beside his wife, BETH, and son, Tho rides to one side of the shouting crowd.
Listen to me!  Do you want to save your crops?  Or would you rather see your farms go to ruin?
How is he saving our farms?  How? Ichabod Crane has brought into our midst the soulless, moldering corpse of a heretic!
Ichabod examines the Crone's neck wound with magnificatio spectacles.  Young Masbath is seated, ledger in his lap.
The wound is neither smooth nor cauterized, but jagged.  She bleeds like a fountain. Ichabod lifts her dead hand to show bruises and cuts.
She did not go quietly.

Doctor Lancaster wrings his hands.  His WIFE rocks nervou in a rocking chair.  The CROWD outside ROARS as a bonfire lights up the curtained windows. The front door is POUNDED open.  ANGRY MEN enter.  Lancas stands, lips quivering.  He points insistently to a door.
Angry men break in.  Ichabod looks up.
Step aside, Constable.  Step aside... Ichabod is shoved aside, spectacles knocked off. The group grasps the Crone.  Masbath stands on his chair, clutching the ledger.  Ichabod grabs one man.
What are you doing? The man slams Ichabod back. Magnification spectacles are crushed under foot.
Angry men carry the corpse to a raging bonfire.  The mob makes way.  Steenwyck cheers them.

Let her burn!  Let her burn! Ichabod comes out, followed by Young Masbath.  The Crone' corpse is thrown in the fire.  Cheers all around. At Ichabod's side, a man tries to grab the ledger Young Masbath holds.  Young Masbath cries out, hanging on to th book.  Ichabod joins the struggle. Katrina watches, emotions conflicting. Other men grab Ichabod.  One punches Ichabod in the face. Katrina rides forward as Baltus calls for her to stop. Katrina leaps down, into the crowd, pulls men off Ichabod

Stop this!  Leave them alone! A SHOT RINGS OUT.  Chaos halts.  Everyone turns, quieting The men around Masbath and Ichabod turn to face Brom Bone Brom holds a smoking pistol, flanked by Theodore and Glen
Let them go (pointing)
Are you going to beat an orphaned child, imbecile? Masbath is released, along with the ledger.  Steenwyck mo forward, pushing people aside.
Are you Ichabod Crane's protector, Brom Bones?
Only for the moment.
You side with him in this?
No.  I agree he has only made matters worse.  But, that will change, if you listen. He trades with Theodore, pistol for a long rifle.  Brom h the rifle, taking a round slug from his pocket.

Theodore, Glenn and I offer to ride each day and night to watch over the Hollow.  We will stalk the border of the Western Woods and haunt the Horseman for a change, with rifles like this... and slugs like this... Brom brings the slug to his lips, blows.  It WHISTLES.
Hollowed out and filled with powder. Brom smiles at Katrina, who watches unimpressed.
Constable Crane is not the only one who fights with science on his side.
I fired upon the Horseman and the bullet did nothing.
You must have missed your mark.
I hit him square.
(to the crowd)

I say... if the Horseman is solid enough to take the lives of our people, he's solid enough to feel this... Brom aims the rifle at a BARREL down the road.  FIRES. PLUNK -- the barrel is hit -- EXPLODES.  Smoke wafts.
In bed, Ichabod is having unpleasant dreams once more. FREAKISH WOMAN (v.o.)
The night of the great storm, I saw her cross my windows.
Young Ichabod is seated beside Father, eyes tearful.  We back in the court where Mother stands trial.
In the lightning, I did see her. (points to Mother)
Her. Lady Crane... I will never forget it.  The next moment, I found my infant son was dead, with the blood welt on his breast. The evil Third Man turns to a jury of TWELVE MEN.
You have heard it.  The blood welt is the mark of Satan's touch. As the crowd murmurs in fear, Young Ichabod looks to Fath who sits with hands clenched, emotionless.
In the quiet kitchen, Young Ichabod looks across the tabl Father stares into his food.
She was with me, father.
Nothing can be done against them.
She was with me that night. Father doesn't even look up.
Empty church.  Young Ichabod carries a lantern past pews. soldier is seated near the altar with a rifle.
May I see her? The soldier exits through a white door.  Young Ichabod wa looking up at the vast church.  The white door opens and Third Man steps out.
Go home.
May I see my mother?
You do not want to be here.  Go home to your father.
She did not do it... please listen...
She is guilty.
No, sir, please... she is innocent...
She has confessed.
No.
She has admitted to her evil and signed a written confession.  Do you know what confession is? (off Ichabod's nod)
All that is left for you now is to pray for her soul. The Third Man leaves through the white door.
Young Ichabod buttons his shirt.
Young Ichabod comes out, looks to the lawn, not understanding.  Father loads a wagon full of belongings.
We are leaving. (long pause)
She has gone away. Realization comes to Young Ichabod.  He runs, away across lawn as Father calls after him.
Young Ichabod runs, weeping. THIRD MAN (v.o.)
She has confessed.
Empty.  Doors are thrown open and Young Ichabod enters. goes down the aisle, towards the white door. THIRD MAN (v.o.)
She has admitted to her evil and signed a written confession.
Mother.
Young Ichabod enters, halting.  The room contains TORTURE DEVICES: iron cuffs, thumb screws, knifes and needles. THIRD MAN (v.o.)

Do you know what confession is? He walks, numb, eyes locked forward... In the corner is a SPIKED CHAIR, adorned with sharp iron spikes.  Hundreds of spikes.  It is fitted with straps fo holding down the "accused." Tears stream down Young Ichabod's face.  He kneels, hands the spikes of the chair, pressing hard. As he sobs, blood runs down from his hands.
In bed, Ichabod opens tear filled eyes.  He sits up, brin his trembling hands to wipe his cheeks.  His hands trail blood. He looks to them... The old scars are bleeding.
Katrina comes to the door.  Ichabod is seated by the fire eyes bleary, palms wrapped with bloodied cloth.
Constable Crane? Katrina comes beside Ichabod's chair.
Allow me some time.  I have spent every hour in the company of others. I need to be alone.
What troubles you? She moves in front.  Ichabod gets up and crosses to sit facing away.  Katrina takes the chair he deserted.
The things I said to you before... I was wrong to say them.
No, actually, you were not.  Every word you spoke had truth in it.
What has happened? Ichabod sits silent, puts his head back, eyes closed.
Lady Van Tassel... she is your stepmother, isn't she?  She bears so little resemblance.
What?
She is not your birth mother, is she?
No, but... why do you ask that?
What happened to your mother?  Is she still alive?
She died.  Her lungs were diseased... two years ago.  What is this about?
Memories have come back.  I had them forgotten, and wish I could forget them again... but they are here now.  (pause)
Lord, how I hate this place.
If you want me to go, I will.  Do you want me to leave?
I... I do not know.  I no longer know what I think or what I feel. Katrina walks to him.  She touches his back.

Why are you so afraid of that?  Is there truly such harm in uncertainty? She kneels, smiles a little for him.  She reaches to touc his face, holds his head in her hands.  Leans to kiss him He rests his head against hers, weary, putting his arms around her.  They kiss passionately.
Dawn light, is visible over forests pounded by rain.

location: VAN TASSEL HOUSE, SECOND FLOOR HALL

text: Ichabod exits his room, satchel in hand.  He looks down t hall, then steps back in to take a white rose from a vase AROUND A CORNER, Ichabod comes to the last door.  He bend slipping the white rose under the crack of the door.
Rain.  Ichabod comes out.  Across the lawn, Young Masbath bringing the horses. LADY VAN TASSEL (o.s.)
Good morrow, Constable. Ichabod turns to see Lady Van Tassel in a chair, sewing.
Returning to the Western Woods?
Yes, actually.
Use caution.
(nods, studies her)
Do you know... I think those are the first words I have heard from you my entire time here.
As my husband says, a wife should be always like an echo, and at the same time, quite unlike an echo. (off Ichabod's confusion)

Like an echo, she should speak only when spoken to, and unlike an echo, should never try to have the last word, or, at least that is what he believes. Baltus comes out the door, irritable, skillet in hand.
Constable... did you notice anything out of the ordinary during the night? Ichabod eyes the skillet, ill at ease, trying not to be.
Um... I... I did not... no.  Why?
Sarah has gone missing... my servant girl.  Her things are gone.  Damn it. She has joined the migration out of town. (to Lady Van Tassel)
What about breakfast, woman?  Or, am I to starve to death? Lady Van Tassel gets up and goes in, taking the skillet.
I should be going... good day to you. Ichabod heads towards Young Masbath.  Baltus watches from porch, disgruntled.  He goes in.
Heavy rain.  Ichabod and Young Masbath ride side by side.
If the Crone's wound bled hard, that means she was not killed by the Hessian.  Someone only tried to make it look that way.
You grow sharper by the minute, little man.  It boggles my mind, but I begin to prefer your company over all others.
Well... I'm one of the few people who likes you.
(laughs)
True enough.
Then, who murdered the Old Crone?  And why?
Good questions, deserving answers, of which we are in short supply. A SOUND is HEARD.  Ichabod looks back, then to Masbath.
Quicken pace. Ichabod rides faster.  Young Masbath keeps up. FURTHER ON, they charge over a hill.  Ichabod halts Gunpo and climbs clumsily off.

Ride on. Young Masbath obeys.  Ichabod takes out his pistol and wa into forest growth, backtracking. INSIDE THE FOREST, Ichabod bounds through underbrush, low HORSE is HEARD SNORTING.  He pushes through branches... Moving behind a FIGURE IN A GREY CLOAK on horseback.
Halt and turn.  I have a pistol aimed at your head. The figure stops, pushes off the cloak hood.  Katrina.
It is only me.
Katrina.  Why do you follow?
I apologize if I worried you.
A woman should not be out alone in these woods.
But, I am not alone, am I?  I only wished to see what you were up to, and... (takes out WHITE ROSE)
To thank you. Ichabod softens, but doesn't want to.
Come along.

location: WESTERN WOODS, TREE OF THE DEAD

text: Raining still.  Ichabod, Masbath and Katrina come into a clearing, mouths falling open at the sight of... A monstrously huge TREE OF THE DEAD, at the clearing's center, with branches reaching far and wide, knotted and gross, like agony captured in wood sculpture. Ichabod dismounts, crossing a line beyond which grass and weeds will not grow.  Young Masbath and Katrina dismount.

You were right... it does draw attention to itself. Ichabod stares up into the endless, dead canopy of branch He circles the incredibly wide trunk. There's a VERTICAL WOUND in the bark, as if the tree once a terrible vertical in it, now partially healed and disgustingly scarred.  Ichabod approaches. He feels the mushy scar, picking at its scabs till much s begins to trickle. It is red and Ichabod fingers it.
Blood.
What did you say? Ichabod goes to where Katrina and Masbath wait with the horses, digs in a saddle bag for a hand axe.
What is it?

Stay back. At the trunk, Ichabod thumps the flat end of the axe agai the suture.  It sounds hollow.  Ichabod begins to chop. He pulls away loose bark.  The tree drips more blood and clear goo.  Ichabod uses both hands on the axe to hack at festering suture.
What are you doing?

Just... keep where you are. Ignoring, Young Masbath moves closer.  Ichabod keeps chopping, then grips a large, loose flap of wood, trying bend it.  It's not easy.  Ichabod struggles. Katrina follows Masbath's slow advance. Ichabod's pulling... the flap suddenly gives, revealing a blood-soaked, wide-eyed, gap-mouthed HUMAN HEAD. Ichabod recoils.  Behind him, Katrina stifles a scream, taking Young Masbath in her arms to keep him from looking It is Philipse's head, hanging off the trunk flap, held b roots grown around and into the flesh. Ichabod reapproaches, back of his hand to his mouth. FOUR other SEVERED, DECAYING HEADS are held by ingrown ro within the dewy innards.
My God... what has happened?
He... he tries to take the heads... they will not pass. He looks to the branches towering above.
Must be some sort of gateway.  But, why this place... ?
We should go.
Why this tree? Ichabod begins looking at the ground, moving around the t He gets to his knees, pushing mud away. Uncovering a flush HEADSTONE carved with "666."
(to himself)
"Climb down to the Horseman's soulless place." (to Masbath)
Bring the shovel.

location: WESTERN WOODS, TREE OF THE DEAD

text: Rain.  Young Masbath's crouched, muddy, rifle across his knees.  He's watching the tree. Behind him, Katrina climbs out of the shallow grave near pile of mud.  Ichabod hands up the shovel.
Masbath, we've found it. Young Masbath goes to the grave.  Ichabod pulls at thick burlap cloth, straining as it comes away. Ichabod looks down, disbelieving.
It cannot be true. WE SEE: roots have gripped the Horseman's bones and tatte uniform.  The skeleton is all there -- except the skull.
Why is it every grave I open holds a new mystery inside?
The skull is gone.
Yes.  I did notice that, thank you. Ichabod climbs out, weary in body and spirit.  LIGHTNING. THUNDER.  He stares at the bones.
This is his silent shrieking... and his desire, to reclaim his head. Ichabod turns, looking to the bordering forest.
"He who holds fast the Horseman's desire will guide his reaping hand."  (pause)
Someone controls the Horseman. KATRINA (o.s.)

Ichabod! Ichabod turns, looks... Katrina and Young Masbath back away, because the ROOTS in grave are ALIVE, further entwining around remains. Ichabod spins to the twisted tree... The vertical SUTURE SEETHES, pulling inwards... sucking Philipse's head back in and closing, bubbling. Ichabod bounds over grave dirt pile, hastening Katrina an Young Masbath along as he flees. At the tree, the suture swells. Ichabod, Katrina and Young Masbath pass where their freak horses are tied to a fallen trunk, heading for cover. A RUMBLING is HEARD from the twisted tree, which suddenly BURSTS wide, spitting smoldering cinders. At the tree line, Ichabod, Katrina and Young Masbath cowe looking back. From the tree wound, a glow brightens, till the Headless Horseman and Daredevil EXPLODE into existence... They hit the ground running. Ichabod watches the Horseman ride away with bolts of LIGHTNING STRIKING the GROUND BEHIND. The Horseman disappears in the forest.
His next victim is chosen! (to Masbath)
Give me distance, then guide her back to the Hollow. Ichabod runs towards the horses.
Constable!
The Horseman rips past on Daredevil.
Ichabod rides as fast as Gunpowder is able.
Small home.  Killian, Thomas and Beth have finished suppe Beth clears plates as Killian picks his teeth with a knif
May I be excused, father?
Do you deserve to be?
(shyly)
I think so.
(smiles)
Then, go. Thomas gets down from his chair.  He goes to the fireplac light a tallow wick, which he takes to the next room.

Thomas plops on the floor and lights his MAGIC LANTERN: a lantern with an outer sleeve of glass painted with silhouettes of lions and monsters. Thomas turns the lantern and looks to the walls where the creatures, shadows are thrown.  He roars for them, imagin them real and having a grand time.
Beth comes for more dishes.
Don't pick teeth.  You teach Thomas bad habits. Killian pulls her to him, playful.
I am a bad habit.  There's nothing for it.
(kisses him)
No one knows better than I.
Thomas continues his fun, shadow animals circling him. In the shifting light, a baby spider comes from a crack i the wall.  Then, another spider skitters out.  More follo

A black horse runs, hooves pounding the ground.  THUNDER HEARD.  The horse slows and stops... it is Brom's horse, Brom aboard.  Brom looks skyward. The storm harshens, roaring through the trees.  Distant HOOFBEATS can be HEARD.  POUNDING. Brom takes his rifle off his shoulder.  The HOOFBEATS gro LOUDER and PASS, far away.  Brom turns in the saddle and WHISTLES.  He kicks his horse and rides.
Thomas still watches shadow beasts, but sees something el He goes to the crack where hundreds of spiders flee all directions. Thomas is amused.
Behind Killian, mantelpiece stones pulse, breathing almos imperceptibly.  Demonic faces form, then disappear and re again, shifting.  WIND HOWLS.
Beth enters, looking at Thomas.
What are you doing there? The magic lantern stops spinning.  Shadow creatures freez
The ENTIRE HOUSE CREAKS.  Killian looks up.  CREAKING STO The HOWLING WIND is LOUD.
Beth comes to Thomas' side as he points.
Spiders. Beth bends to see the swarming spiders.  She looks up, noticing the FEROCITY of the WIND.
Killian stands, looking up.  The HOUSE CREAKS again, then suddenly the WIND CEASES.  Silence.
Beth...
Beth picks up Thomas.  The magic lantern creatures begin spinning anew, all around.

With a ROAR, the fire flares.  Killian looks. WHHOOOSH the fire shoots up the fireplace.  Gone. Behind Killian, the DOOR SPLINTERS INWARDS.  The Horseman steps in, a battle axe in each hand.  WIND BLASTS... The DOOR to the other room SLAMS. Killian grabs a kitchen chair and hurls it at the Horsema The Horseman swings, smashing it aside.
Beth... run!
Beth hugs Thomas to her as she backs away. KILLIAN (o.s.) (from kitchen)
Get out!

Killian grabs an iron skewer from the fireplace, swings i fend off a blow from the Horseman. The Horseman swings the other axe.  Killian ducks.  The a cracks fireplace stone, throwing sparks. Killian lunges, jamming the skewer into the Horseman. The skewer comes through the Horseman's back.  The Horsem swipes with the flat of one axe -- pounding Killian aside Killian hits the wall, bashing his head.  Hits the floor.
Beth kicks a carpet to reveal a trap door.
The Horseman pulls the skewer out of his body, throws it. goes to lift Killian by the hair with one hand, brings ba the axe in the other...
At the trap door, Beth lowers Thomas to stairs leading to cellar.  Thomas is crying.
Don't let him get you.
Mommy...

You hide now... go... Beth closes the trap door, frantically replacing the carp The room's door flies open and the Horseman strides in, carrying Killian's severed head.  Beth shrieks. The Horseman steps forward, knocks over the magic lantern

Beth's SCREAMS are abruptly CUT OFF.  Her BODY is HEARD HITTING the floor above.  Thomas crosses the cellar, stumbles.  He scurries into the shelter of a wheelbarrow propped against the wall.  FOOTSTEPS are HEARD.
The Horseman's hands place Killian's and Beth's heads in sack, cinching the sack shut.
The Headless Horseman enters, bends to retrieve the battl axe he left.  He stands.  Pause.
Thomas' trembling hands pull the wheelbarrow closer.  QUI He tries to control his sobbing.
The Horseman turns, falls to his knees.  He starts to cho the floor with both axes.  CHOPping,  CHOPping,  CHOPping making quick work of it...
A hole appears in the ceiling as debris falls. Thomas looks up, terrified.  He gets up to run away... The Horseman's arm shoves through above, grasping Thomas yanking him up.

Brom rides from the forest, charging across Killian's fie At Killian's house, Daredevil rides up as the Headless Horseman walks out with his sack of heads.  The Horseman the sack to the saddle and leaps up. Brom puts his reins in his mouth, raising his rifle. The Horseman heads away, past the barn, as Brom gains. Brom aims... FIRES! BOOM -- the slug EXPLODES, blowing the Horseman off Daredevil.  Daredevil keeps going.  The Horseman's smolde body is left "face down." Brom halts his horse.  He climbs down, pleased. The Horseman moves. Brom backs away, satisfaction diminishing. The Horseman gets on his knees. Brom falls to one knee, begins reloading.  He fills the g from his powder horn. The Horseman stands, unsheathes his sword and turns.  The blast has blown apart his uniform at the chest and should exposing rotten flesh and maggot-infested muscle. Brom readies his ramrod, jamming powder in the barrel. The Horseman charges. Brom stands, pulling out the ramrod.  The Horseman is on Brom swings the rifle, blocking.  Sparks fly. The battle is on, with Brom fending off the Horseman's sw with the gun -- CLANK -- CLANK -- CLANK. ACROSS THE FIELD, Ichabod and Gunpowder break into the op UP THE FIELD, the Horseman makes a backhanded swing.  Bro goes down, his rifle sent flying. Brom rolls to avoid as the Horseman slashes. Brom flees.  The Horseman pulls and throws a knife... THWAP -- the knife imbeds in Brom's thigh. The Horseman runs towards Brom. Ichabod closes in, pulling an unlit lantern off his saddl Brom tries to get up, bends to extract the knife. The Horseman, mid-run, changes his sword grip, blade down He plants one foot on Brom's back, raising his sword, abo to skewer... Ichabod arrives full gallop, SMASHES the lantern into the Horseman -- knocking the Horseman off Brom. AT THE EDGE OF THE FOREST, Theodore and Glen arrive on horseback.  They hold a moment, watching. Brom runs, limping, to the barn, goal in sight: farm implements propped there.  Brom grabs SCYTHES with long curved blades, one in per hand. The Horseman rises. Ichabod turns Gunpowder and leaps off, runs to Brom. The Horseman moves towards them, hefting a battle axe in free hand.  Ichabod steps up, pistol aimed, furious.

For what it's worth... FIRES -- the bullet rips through the Horseman's stomach t reveal putrid innards as he keeps advancing. At the forest, Theodore looks to Glenn, turns and flees. Brom steps up, scythes ready.  He and the Horseman go at Brom blocks axe and sword, catching and deflecting blows. At the forest, Glenn follows Theodore away. Ichabod grabs a long handled SICKLE. Brom swings the scythes.  The Horseman avoids. Ichabod moves to the side, looking for an opening.  He sw the sickle. The Horseman blocks. The Horseman battles both at once, catching blows... countering every strike, METAL RINGING. Brom catches the Horseman's sword in one scythe, holding off.  Catches the axe handle in the other scythe. The Horseman flatfoot KICKS Brom's chest, sending him dow Ichabod swings the sickle blade... Hits the Horseman, the blade embedding to the hilt. The Horseman drops his axe and grasps the sickle, jerking The sickle handle SLAMS Ichabod's, knocking him away. Ichabod crawls, tries to shake off the blow. He looks up.  The Horseman staggers, spastically trying t pull the blade from his body. Brom limps to Ichabod, yanks him to his feet.
We cannot win this. They head towards the forest. Behind, the Horseman extracts the sickle, throws it.  He strides after them, picks up his axe on the way.
Ichabod and Brom stumble down a hillside.  Brom points.
There... They run to a DOCK at the edge of a wide, rapid river.  T jump into a FLAT BOAT barge.

Go to the front and guide it. Ichabod goes.  Brom uses a scythe to slash the ropes. Ichabod picks up a GUIDE POLE.  The barge lurches, set fr Ichabod struggles to push the boat out.  it moves swiftly caught in rain swollen current. Brom looks back.  No Horseman.  He leaves the scythe and moves to the front, hefting another pole to help guide.
Let's see him catch us now. Ichabod looks to the shore.  Horror.
Look. LIGHTNING ILLUMINATES -- ahead, the Horseman stands on th bank with Axe and sword.  Daredevil near.

We'll pass right by the son of a bitch. Ichabod and Brom push with the poles, trying for speed. At the bank, the Horseman walks directly to the water... Just as he takes a step onto the water, the rain churned surface TRANSFORMS -- instantly BECOMING a SHEET of ICE.. SPREADING and supporting the Horseman as he advances. ICE SHOOTS OUT ahead of him, towards a point in the river where it will intercept the barge.

My Christ... The Horseman's ICE BRIDGE engulfs the barge, HALTING IT. Ichabod and Brom are thrown.  The barge is trapped. The Horseman nears. Brom runs to the rear to retrieve his scythe.  Ichabod ho up the only weapon he has, his guide pole. The Horseman steps on board.  Ichabod swings.  The Horsem axe cracks the pole in half... The Horseman thrusts with sword -- into Ichabod's chest - clean through.  It SIZZLES as Ichabod screams. The Horseman lifts Ichabod up, flips him, pulling the swo out as Ichabod goes... SMASHING through the ice and under. UNDERWATER: water carries Ichabod, slams him against ice above. He's pulled down by undertow.
