ABOVE WATER, beyond the edge of the ice bridge: Ichabod c up, gasping, choking on rain. He treads water, looking to the barge. ICHABOD'S P.O.V.
Aboard the barge, the Horseman cuts Brom down... stands o him, chopping with sword.  Our VIEW grows BLURRY, and...
Candlelight.  Ichabod, shirtless, feverish, opens his eye The wound at the top of his chest is raw.  Katrina insert needle in the skin around it.
Lay still, Ichabod.  Do not move.
Doctor, he is awake. Ichabod tries to sit.  Pain stops him.  Lady Van Tassel h bleed the wound with the needle and a tube leading to a SUCTION JAR of blood.
(barely a voice)
What... what are you doing... ?
I'm drawing bad blood from the wound. Doctor Lancaster comes to the bed.
Keep still, Constable.  You were half-drowned when they found you.
... Brom Bones...
He is dead.  You would be also, if your wound had not somehow shut.
Bring Young Masbath here.
You need to sleep.
Bring him.
You need rest. Ichabod gives up, closes his eyes.  Katrina, needle in on hand, brings her other hand to hold Ichabod's. Blood drips into the suction jar.

Ichabod is soundly asleep.  Across the room, Katrina is a his work table.  Ichabod stirs.  Katrina looks to him. Once she is satisfied he will not wake, she returns to wh she was doing, turning a page.  She is reading his ledger

Young Masbath lies awake.  A glint of light crosses the window.  Masbath looks to it, gets up, peers out. THROUGH THE WINDOW, he can see the Van Tassel Manor House the distance.  Lantern LIGHT crosses the lawn.

The lantern light moves through the orchard, away from th house.  We cannot make out the person. Elsewhere, Young Masbath runs in pursuit.  He hides again one tree, leans to look... The light enters forest.  Young Masbath follows.
Ichabod's hurting.  Masbath helps with a shirt.
Someone left last night.  Looked like they headed to the square, but I lost them in the forest.
Man or woman?
All I saw was their lantern.
Business, best hidden is hidden best at night. Ichabod goes to his work table, organizing his satchel.
If someone has the Horseman's skull... if they control the Horseman, then why haven't they sent him for your head yet?
Because, I serve a fine purpose alive. It is perfection for our murderer if I return to New York City with nothing more than tales of a galloping ghoul.  (pause)

We must uncover the reason these victims were targeted.  What was taken from them... other than their lives? Who benefits by their deaths? Ichabod fumbles the bottle of white powder. It bounces, cork popping out... rolls under the bed.
Damn it. Ichabod kneels, pained.  A trail of the blood-detecting powder has spilled.  The bottle is out of reach.
I'll get it. Young Masbath gets down, ready to crawl for it, but Ichab stops him, peering under.

Wait... Far under, near the bottle, some powder is bubbling. Ichabod moves to the end of the bed and lifts, in pain.  Young Masbath helps. They drag the bed to one side. Under the bed: a Satanic PENTAGRAM has been DRAWN IN BLOO Ichabod stares, trying to grasp the implication.  Masbath about to speak, but Ichabod puts a finger to his lips. Ichabod moves to lock the door.
(whispers)
Who did this? Ichabod does not answer.  He picks up a wash basin and du the water to wash the Pentagram away.

WAGONS, HORSES and TOWNSPEOPLE swarm.  A CROWD loots the town's general store.  Provisions are passed along man to and loaded on wheelbarrows. All up and down the long straight road, home owners board windows with lumber. Ichabod and Young Masbath ride, passing many angry faces.

Panic has set in. They stop, tying their horses and climbing stairs to the of the "NOTARY."  Ichabod looks off... DOWN THE ROAD, at the far end, people head to the church. Much activity there as well.
Sanctuary.  Or, so they hope. Families put up tents all around the church within the bordering wrought-iron fence.  Supplies abound. People work to build and erect massive wooden crosses.
Tidy room.  Young Masbath watches Ichabod hand a slip of paper to the elderly Notary, Hardenbrook.
Do you have these persons' wills?
I have everything... last testaments... birth certificates, death certificates... deeds.
Yes, sir... but, do you have these? Hardenbrook studies the paper with his one good eye.
Certainly... certainly. Hardenbrook nods, handing the list back, grinning.  Ichab stands waiting.  Hardenbrook is still nodding.
May I see them, Master Hardenbrook?
Hmm?  See them?
May we look at them now?
Of course.  You want them... it shall not take long.  Wait here. Hardenbrook heads across the room.  Ichabod offers the li
Maybe you should take this.
A fine idea. Hardenbrook takes it and exits.  Young Masbath sits.
What good is this?

To discover what might have been taken from those who died, it will help to know what was there that could be taken in the first place. Ichabod waits.  After a moment, he looks uncertain.  He crosses to the half-open door...

Ichabod sticks his head in, not liking what he sees. Hardenbrook's amidst unbelievable disarray.  Tables, shel and baskets of unevenly piled documents. Hardenbrook looks on a shelf, confused, then goes to a ta lifting papers, mumbling.
Damn... damn... damn...
Master Hardenbrook... Hardenbrook turns, a bit startled.
Perhaps, I could assist in finding them?
Well... that might be... helpful.
Hardenbrook is asleep in a chair, snoring, blind eye open Ichabod and Young Masbath face official-looking documents with Ichabod focused on one will in hand.
My father had farm land.  It was the only thing we owned of any value.
(still reading)
And it now belongs to you, according to Baltus.  I heard him say it.
Yes. Ichabod turns the will in his hand to Masbath.
Then look here at your father's will, and tell me why you are not listed. Young Masbath takes it, boggled.  Ichabod grabs another.

Van Garrett had denoted his elder son in his last wishes; the same son murdered along with him.  But Van Garrett's wife and two infant children are not written... and they were spared. (picks up another will)
Do you see?  Philipse had no family to bestow his farm to.  But, here... (picks up another)

The Widow Windsor was listed on her late husband's will.  After her inheritance, she amended the document to include her bastard child.  This is why the Horseman made absolutely certain to impale the unborn descendant. Ichabod sits back.
Only the heirs were killed.  Proof that the Horseman slaughters by assignment.
But, if the farm is not mine, who stole it away?
No one yet, far as I can tell.  It has gone intestate.
In test... what?
Intestate.  Your farm... all the farms... they belong to no one.
What does it mean? Ichabod stares off.
Often in such cases, property which has gone intestate legally passes to whomever the deceased was indebted to. And, who in this town is owed a great many debts?
(realization)
Baltus Van Tassel.
Did your father take a loan?
Yes.  I rode with him on payment days. Ichabod stands, grim, gathering wills and his ledger.
Tonight, we answer questions.  And, to discover who moves about the Van Tassel house after dark... all we need is a candle. A LOUD NOISE is HEARD from the other room.  Ichabod looks
Ichabod bursts in.  No one there.  A chair has been knock over and the front door is ajar.  Ichabod moves...
Ichabod exits.  All around is the commotion in the square before.  No telling who it was who just fled.
Young Masbath is seated, bored.  Ichabod writes in his ledger.  A KNOCK on the door.  They both look up. KATRINA (o.s.) (from outside door)
Constable... are you there? (long pause)
Ichabod? The knob is tried and found locked.  Pause.  At the botto the door, a red rose is passed under. This saddens Ichabod.

Quiet night.  The church is a sight, with a yard resembli an empty squatter's tent city, surrounded by crosses. Boarded over windows leak shafts of light. MOVING PAST THE WINDOWS: many eyes peer out from the slat UP IN THE BELFRY, TWO RIFLEMEN are on watch.
Ichabod and Masbath are in darkness, still waiting.  Icha takes the cover off a lantern, looks at a clock.  Midnigh straight up.  Ichabod stands, picks up an unlit candle.
Midnight seems an appropriate time.

Ichabod and Young Masbath look out, cautious.  They move the nearest door. Ichabod crouches, using the candle to mark the seam of th door and door frame.  He's making a low, wax seal.  If th door opens, the seal will break. They move to a second door, quietly.  Ichabod makes anoth low wax mark.
Ichabod and Masbath come downstairs to a hall.  Ichabod continues his wax marking at each door.

Ichabod and Young Masbath enter, shutting the door.  Icha walks to shelves at Baltus' desk, looks through ribbon bo DOCUMENTS and hands some to Masbath. Young Masbath pulls off the ribbon, pages through these " AGREEMENT" parchments.  Ichabod brings another pile.
(whispering)
They are alphabetical. Young Masbath has the M's.  "MARYIE," "MEGAPOLENISIS," AN "MELYN..." Not finding what he wants.
There is no Masbath here.  My father's loan papers are missing.
(regarding his documents)

There are none for Magistrate Philipse either.  "Paasch, James" "Pieter, Thomas" "Pos, William." A FLOORBOARD CREAKS.  Ichabod looks, blows out the lanter He and Young Masbath stand frozen. Across the room, light comes under the door, stops, then continues.  A DOOR is HEARD OPENING and SHUTTING.  Ichabo crosses to follow, pointing back.
Keep looking.  Then, hide in my room and bolt the door till I return.
Lantern light moves, far ahead.  Ichabod follows.
Ichabod stops, hidden.  He can see the light ahead, but i no longer in motion.  He advances.

A lantern sits on a rock.  On a blanket, a semi-naked MAN semi-naked WOMAN are in the midst of rough SEX. Ichabod crawls to peer from underbrush. The couple keeps coupling, with the man on top.  His grun and gasps are particularly desperate.  He's all over the woman, who lays back... it is Lady van Tassel. Ichabod swallows, inches closer. Lady van Tassel pulls the man's shirt, exposes his flesh. She raises a small, sharp KNIFE behind his back. Ichabod's eyes widen. Lady Van Tassel brings the blade to her own hand, slicing deep in her palm.  Blood flows.  She rubs her cut hand ov her partner's arching back, smearing blood. Lady van Tassel caresses the man's chest, neck, face... trailing blood.  The man lifts his head, in ecstasy, suck the woman's bloody fingers... it's Clergyman Steenwyck. Ichabod backs away, having seen more than plenty.
Young Masbath unlocks the door.  Ichabod enters.
I was getting worried.  Who was it?
Lady Van Tassel.
What was she doing?
Something I really wish I had not seen. Never mind it.  Did you find the victims' loan agreements?
No.  They are all missing. This troubles Ichabod.
There is more, though.  While you were gone, I could hear someone else walking through the house.
Ichabod and Young Masbath creep round a corner.  Going to LAST DOOR, Ichabod crouches, eyes narrowing...
(whispers, to himself)
Katrina. The wax seal is broken, flecks of wax on the floor.

location: VAN TASSEL HOUSE, FOYER AND HALL

text: Ichabod and Masbath come downstairs, checking all the wax marks.  Young Masbath finds one broken.
Here. Ichabod comes over, pushes the door...
They enter.  The kitchen is empty.  Ichabod crosses to another door, crouches.  Another broken wax mark.
They enter... the room with the elaborate loom.  Ichabod moves his lantern to make a quick search, goes to table. He touches the top of a candle.  His finger comes away wi bit of still wet wax.
There are no other doors.  This is as far as she could have gone.
It is nothing.  She comes to read books, so her father will not find her. (to convince himself)
It is absolutely nothing.
What books?
Fiction plays and novels.  Baltus does not approve.  Now, come.  It may not be long before Lady Van Tassel returns.
But, sir... what books?  Where are they? Ichabod stops, looking around.  No books anywhere.
If there is a secret place for books... it could be just as good for the missing loan agreements. Ichabod ponders this without saying anything.

- Drawers are opened and searched, quietly. - Young Masbath uses a candle to look up the fireplace. - Ichabod opens a linen cabinet, unfolding blankets. - Young Masbath looks in a closet filled with big spools sewing thread, on his knees, pulls a wooden box forward. Inside it, he finds only old cups and silverware. Ichabod pulls up a rug, feeling along the floorboards. Young Masbath crawls, doing the same.  He climbs under th loom, tapping on the floor.  TAP... TAP... TAP... He crawls further under the loom.  TAP... TAP... PLONK. hollow sound.  He taps again... PLONK... PLONK.

Constable. Ichabod comes over as Young Masbath lifts a loose board. Under the floor, there are piles of books.  Masbath bring them up, handing them to Ichabod, who studies the spines. Young Masbath reaches in up to his shoulder.  He comes up with "LOAN AGREEMENTS."
Fie!  Here they are. Ichabod takes them.  Names are near the top: "Masbath," " Garret," "Philipse," and "Killian." Ichabod sits back, numb, his heart bitterly broken.
Lady Van Tassel prepares food with two servants at the op fireplace/oven.  Ichabod enters, rushed.
Excuse me, Lady Van Tassel... Katrina is not in her room.
No.  She has gone out.
Where?
She has taken the last of our grain to be milled. (crossing to him)
You do have a background in the medical arts, don't you, Constable?
Very little.  I must be going... Lady Van Tassel holds out her cut palm, the gash sewn shu
Will you look at this?  I cut my hand this morning: I sewed it myself, but I am afraid it will go bad. Ichabod takes her hand, distracted and nervous.
It appears well.  It has already clotted.
Look closer.  Do you have anything to clean it with?
It is fine.  Now, I must... Lady Van Tassel grabs Ichabod by the wrist, tight.
(whispering, close)
I know you saw me.
What... ? Lady Van Tassel glances to servants, keeps her voice low.
I know you followed last night.  You must promise not to tell Baltus... Ichabod tries to pull away, but she grips tighter.  The F DOOR is HEARD SLAMMING.  Ichabod is panicky.
Have mercy on me.  Please... have mercy. Ichabod pulls away just as Baltus enters.  Lady Van Tasse goes back to work as if nothing happened.
Constable, it is urgent that we speak.
Baltus leads Ichabod to the porch.
Clergyman Steenwyck is calling a meeting.  This time he is determined to have you forced out, or worse.
How did you hear this?
He came to me.  He promised great violence.  Said I should cast you out for my own protection. (troubled pause)
I must speak honestly.  There is no reason to think he will not meet with success. Ichabod looks to barn, sees Masbath bringing the horses. CHURCH BELL is HEARD TOLLING far away.

That is the meeting bell already calling.  With the murder of Killian and Brom, no one sees any good from you.  If... if you were to leave... you might be saving your own life. Ichabod studies Baltus, then offers his hand.  They shake
I appreciate your concern.  I thank you, sir. Ichabod hurries off, across the lawn, exasperated.  He ru Masbath runs to him.  Ichabod takes Gunpowder and climbs
(mounting his horse)
What now?  Where is she?
Things have become complicated. Katrina is at the mill.  Ride ahead, find her and bring her to meet me outside the church.  Find her at all costs.  Quickly. They ride, fast.

A conjuring pile of straw burns.  Gloved hands unfold a p filled with clippings of human hair.  The hair is sprinkl on the fire. A cloaked FIGURE is kneeled at the pile.  The figure turn remove A human SKULL from a cloth bag. The skull is placed at center in the flames.  It's teeth sharp, cut to points.  The HORSEMAN'S SKULL.
In the church yard refugee camp, food is prepared over fi People inhabit the tents.
IN THE CHURCH: it's crowded with families.  Pews filled w bedding and belongings.  Steenwyck comes to CLOSE the DOU DOORS of his quarters, turning, angry.
You are astonishing, Constable.  Do you truly think your ridiculous accusations frighten me? Ichabod is doing nothing to hide his disdain.
Only if I repeat them outside this room.  And, I will if I must... (points to doors)
Out there, for all to hear.  Or... you may speak, as planned.  But, you tell them you feel compelled to move on to greener pastures.
No.  You will not run me out.  No one will believe a word of what you say.
Oh?  Far as I can tell, a rumor does not travel alone for long here.
Are you a deist?  Is that it?  A free thinker who does not believe in divinity.
It is only important what you are. An adulterer...
I am the Lord's voice in this town.
Wallowing in sin and lust...
They need guidance.
Wallowing quite literally in blood.
(snapping, quaking)
Damn you, sir!  God damn you to hell!
He may.  But, not soon enough for you, and not on your behalf. Ichabod walks.  Steenwyck is humiliated.
You are so upset now... and yet, you seemed in such good spirits last night.
You cannot do this.  I am a man of God!
Climb to the top of the tallest ladder you can find, Father.  That is the closest you ever come to God.
Pews are packed.  Steenwyck enters, walks to the altar. EVERYONE QUIETS.  Steenwyck has composed himself, barely.
My friends... dear friends.  Those of you still on your farms, I thank you for coming. He sees Ichabod near the back.  THUNDER is HEARD OUTSIDE.
I... I address unfortunate business.  (pause)
I am forced to take my leave from Sleepy Hollow.  I will be moving on to do the Lord's work elsewhere. The GATHERERS MURMUR shock.  Ichabod walks out.
Raining hard.  Baltus and Lady Van Tassel ride.

Hurry along.  The meeting has most certainly already begun.  We do not want Steenwyck as our enemy. Lady Van Tassel trails.  WOOD is HEARD SPLINTERING... Just off the road, a tree falls... The trunk catches Lady Van Tassel's horse on its rear fla The horse falls.  Lady Van Tassel hits the dirt. Baltus looks back, halting. Lady Van Tassel looks up to Baltus in fear, then turns. Behind her, the Headless Horseman trots from, the forest Daredevil, stops.  Calm.  He takes his axe in hand.
Storming.  The meeting is letting out.  Near the churchya gate, Young Masbath rides with Katrina following on a hor cart.  Ichabod walks up as Katrina dismounts.
What is so urgent?
Come with me. Ichabod leads her to where they can talk away from others
Why have I not seen your face for so long?  You look much better. She touches his face, but he takes her hand, places the l agreements there.
Explain these.  I found them secreted away in the sewing room. Katrina's expression changes just so slightly to guilt.

Why... why have I scrambled and run and clawed in all directions, only to find you against me? He stares at her.  Katrina stares back, in a small way defeated.  She looks for an out, but there is none.
I have been reading your journal. I'm sorry.  I found it too fascinating to resist.  (pause, ashamed)
I rode to catch up with you at the Notary, out of curiosity.  Before I found you though, I overheard what you were said.
It was you there?
When... when you spoke father's name along with accusations, I could not believe it.  I had to hide these... at least till I could confront him myself.
And, what did he say?
He did not do these things.  If you knew him, you would realize...
What did he say, Katrina?
I have not been able to face him yet.
The loans give the land to your father. It does not matter survivors are still on their farms.  They could be thrown off... tomorrow... a year from now.
Yes, I have seen that, and I told you why I hid them.
What would you have me believe?
(tiring, angry)
If you think I am behind this, say it.
The name Van Tassel is blackened.  You share that name.
Call me a liar, then, and a murderess. Say it, out and out. Many people are starting to notice the confrontation.
Katrina...
Speak the words, Constable.  What is stopping you?  What has happened to your ability to transcend sentimentality? Emotions tear at him.  Rain seems to pound down harder.

Oh, no.  No.  Please... don't dare stand looking as if you still care for me, after all that you have said.  If I were to confess, would that ease your suffering?  Would that make it easier for you to hate me?! A TORTURED CRY is HEARD O.S. Baltus comes charging through the square on his horse.
The Horseman is coming! He's barely hanging on.  He stops, practically falling of running towards Katrina and Ichabod.
Save me...
Father?
He killed her... Baltus grasps Katrina, fearful.  HOOFBEATS are HEARD.
The Horseman has killed her. Far behind, the Horseman rides to follow, axe held up. Instant mayhem -- people scatter all directions, screamin Baltus runs headlong to the church.

Father! Katrina runs after Baltus.  Ichabod backs away, watching Horseman come, then heads to the church with Masbath. Baltus pushes through the iron gate, into tent city, join the swarm of townsfolk pouring into the church. The Horseman rides behind, closing the gap.  Men, women a children run for cover all along the square. Amidst the churchyard panic, Ichabod looks back... The Horseman reaches the open gate and Daredevil suddenly rears up, snorting, unwilling to enter. The Horseman grabs Daredevil's reins, tries to move forwa again.  Same result.  Daredevil freaks out.

Baltus makes his way in, shoving.  People are still clamo in through the doors. Men pass rifles from stockpiles and climb onto pews at boarded windows.  Women herd children into a cellar. Baltus searches for a hiding place.  He looks across the church to see Steenwyck closing the doors of his living quarters.  Baltus moves...
Steenwyck! At the front doors, Katrina squeezes in with Ichabod and Young Masbath just as people are forcing the doors closed It's madness.  People outside begin pounding. Katrina searches.
Father! Ichabod goes to a window, looking out between boards.
Across the yard, the Horseman gives his axe an underhand to the ground inside the gate. The AXE instantly BEGINS TO DEGRADE TO DUST in the rain. The Horseman rides, keeping outside the fence.
Ichabod comes away from the window, looking to panicked citizens.  He sees Katrina moving up the aisle... She's heading towards Baltus, who slams against the door Steenwyck's room.
Damn you, Steenwyck!  Help me! Let me in! RIFLES BOOM LOUDLY as men at the windows begin firing.

The Horseman circles, under fire. Great clouds of gun smoke shoot from the church. Men fire down from the belfry. Parts of the Horseman and Daredevil splatter red into the rain as slugs hit without effect. AT THE OTHER SIDE OF THE CHURCH, the Horseman comes aroun heading to the town square.

Rifleman shout to each other, running to the opposite win to follow the Horseman. Young Masbath grabs a rifle and leaps to join the brigade Baltus is still beating Steenwyck's door when a HUGE FARM grips Baltus angrily and throws him...
You'll kill us all! Baltus falls, knocking over pews.  Katrina's nearby.
You're the one the Horseman wants. Why should we die for you!?
The huge farmer picks Baltus up, dragging him and shoving Katrina aside as she approaches. Ichabod's pushing past people, trying to reach them.
The Horseman brings Daredevil to a halt, yanking a large of ROPE off a hitching post.
The huge farmer shoves Baltus to the floor again.
Get out! Others join the rage, pulling Baltus towards the front of church, shouting.  Ichabod struggles to push them off.
Stop this! Ichabod gets to Baltus' side, trying to protect.
The Horseman cannot enter!  It does not matter who he wants, he cannot cross the gate! At the windows, ONE RIFLEMAN turns, crying out.
He's coming back! More panic.  The huge farmer moves towards Baltus.
We have to save ourselves! Baltus pulls the pistol from Ichabod's holster, brandishi
No!  Get away from me!
The Horseman rides past the front, fired upon. He halts at the wrought iron gate, reaching to yank off o POST which is pointed on top, like an arrow head.
Baltus holds everyone's back with the pistol.
The next person to lay hands on me will have a bullet.  Stand off!
Father...
No!  We're safe here. (points at Ichabod)

You said it.  The Horseman will not have me. CRASH, the harpoon-like post SPEARS through a window, trailing rope tied to it... CRACK -- SKEWERS Baltus from behind, the bloodied point bursting out his breast bone. Baltus looks down, drops the gun... clutching the post wi both hands.  Blood streams out his mouth.  Katrina scream The rope yanks Baltus back.  He SLAMS into the WINDOW...

Baltus CRASHES out, hits the ground, dragged... Outside the fence, Daredevil runs with the rope tied arou his saddle pommel.  The Horseman strides forward, sword o Baltus SLAMS the fence and the rope snaps.  He is held th awkwardly, gurgling blood. The Horseman reaches Baltus... chops off his head.

The storm has passed.  Empty forest.  Long, peaceful paus till Ichabod makes his way through, searching the ground. Ichabod comes to look down a small hill.  The corpse of L Van Tassel lies headless, in a dirty, torn dress. Ichabod walks to the body.  Lady Van Tassel's arm is twis behind.  The sewn cut on the palm of her hand faces up.
(shouting back)
Here!  I have found her... (looking at corpse, quiet and miserable)
Here she is.
Doctor Lancaster comes out from where Katrina is asleep. closes the door, wipes his sweaty face.  Ichabod waits.
It has been a terrible jolt to her nerves.
You will stay at her side? Doctor Lancaster nods.  Ichabod walks.
It's getting dark.  Ichabod comes out and crosses the por A few of the Hollow's residents are here.  Young Masbath up and follows Ichabod onto the lawn. Ichabod walks without waiting.
She's the one who controlled the Horseman, isn't she, sir?  Sir?  (no answer)
I need time for thinking.  Without you hanging on my coattails for a change. Ichabod keeps walking.  Young Masbath stops, wounded.

location: WESTERN WOODS, TREE OF THE DEAD

text: Ichabod stands holding a torch, looking up.  The whole ar is bright from the light off a giant fire. There are broken lanterns and barrels around the agonized twisted tree.  The tree is aflame, fire dancing up the tr and through every branch to lick the sky.

Dawn.  Ichabod is seated overlooking the Hudson.  He star at the beauty around him, brooding through bleary eyes. Gunpowder is tied to a tree.  BIRDS SING. The ledger is open in Ichabod's lap.  He thumbs pages absently, just keeps staring off.

A fire burns in a circle of rocks.  Ichabod's ledger is thrown in.  The pages catch quickly. Ichabod watches, then walks away.  He's about to climb on Gunpowder, but on second thought he opens his satchel and digs out a BOOK.  He walks back to the fire, throws it on "Romeo and Juliet."  Flames devour it.

location: WESTERN WOODS, TREE OF THE DEAD

text: The clearing is silent.  The twisted tree still stands, smoldering, impressive as ever, or perhaps even more so w the alien appearance its blackened skin now affords it.
Ichabod packs up baggage.  Young Masbath is miserable.
Won't you change your mind, sir? What can I say to convince you?
Nothing.  To hell with this place and all the people here. Ichabod closes a bag, throws it with others.
Why... why are you like this?
(pause, softening)
You do not know all that has happened. (pause)
You cannot understand.
A coach, with Gunpowder as one of its team, waits in the orchard.  Van Ripper comes to meet Ichabod and Masbath.

Half now.  Half when we reach the city. Ichabod hands Van Ripper money.  Van Ripper takes the baggage.  Ichabod looks to the Manor House.  Only one lig shines, in a second floor window. Katrina can be seen there a moment as she closes curtains Ichabod turns to Young Masbath, who is beginning to cry.
This is farewell.
Take me with you.  There's nothing left for me here.
I cannot. (bends to Masbath)
You should not worry. (pause, sorrow)
Van Ripper and his wife will look after you.  They will.  You will be well cared for. Young Masbath hugs.  Ichabod hugs back, swallowing.
I am sorry. (quietly)
Forgive me.  I failed you. Ichabod releases and goes quickly away, finding this mise unbearable.  He climbs in the coach.

Do not go, Constable.  How can you leave? INSIDE THE COACH, Ichabod slumps back in darkness and clo his eyes.  He pounds twice on the coach wall. OUTSIDE, Van Ripper whips the reins.  The coach starts. Young Masbath follows.  The coach picks up speed on the l straight road. Young Masbath stops, wiping tears.
Ichabod's coach moves through the town square.  A few peo in the churchyard's tent city come out to watch it pass.
The door is pushed open.  Young Masbath enters, looks aro the empty room.  He goes to sit in a chair at the work ta crossing his arms and resting his head.
A plate of food sits untouched.  Katrina is slumped down chair, heartbroken, staring into the fireplace. Behind her, a shadow moves across the room.
Van Ripper leads the coach through the stone pillars mark the entrance of Sleepy Hollow.
Ichabod takes off his hat, sets it on the seat.  The wind between him and the driver slides open.
Sir... this is yours. (offering something)
The Van Tassel girl said to give it to you after you were gone. Ichabod takes it.  It is the bird/cage spinning toy.  He studies it.  What melancholy.
Katrina sits with her eyes closed.  A BOARD is HEARD CREAKING.  She sits up. Suddenly, a FIGURE in black is be her as she turns.  WHACK! -- a gloved fist strikes.
A dull THUD is HEARD downstairs, like a body falling.  Yo Masbath takes notice.  He moves to the door...

Ichabod turns the strings on the bird/cage toy, ponders i The paper disk spins, images flickering until the bird appears to be inside the cage. Ichabod keeps spinning it, looks out the window. A tear rolls down his cheek. The bird cage toy's rotation slows... stops. Ichabod looks at it a long moment, then pockets it and le forward to the window at front.
Ichabod's face appears behind Van Ripper.
Van Ripper, turn the coach about!
What did you say?
Turn around.  Now!
Young        Masbath comes down the stairs, looking aroun
Hello?  Katrina? Masbath starts down a hall.  He does not see, in another room, Katrina's body is dragged across the floor.
The coach comes to Lancaster's.  Ichabod climbs out befor even stops fully, satchel in hand.  He hurries...
Doctor Lancaster, half asleep, comes to answer BANGING on door.  Ichabod pushes past, taking Lancaster's lantern.
Pardon the intrusion...
Ichabod enters.  There are two coffins on the floor.
I never examined these bodies. Ichabod removes the lid from one coffin.  Lancaster is ab to say something indignant, but then just looks disgusted
... help yourself, you pompous ass. I will be in bed.
Would you stay, doctor?  I may need assistance. Lancaster reluctantly remains.  Ichabod stares at the dea Lady Van Tassel.  The neck wound is covered by a stained brown cloth, which Ichabod unwraps.
Stains of blood.
What of it? Ichabod takes out one of the lenses that survived the magnification spectacles, bends to examine the neck.
Jagged flesh.  (pause)
The Horseman did not do this. Ichabod moves to the side of the coffin, lifting the hand with the stitched gash on its palm.

Here, Doctor.  Hold this just so... Lancaster holds the lens so that Ichabod can study the cu through it.  Ichabod takes a scalpel-like knife from his satchel, lifts the hand and cuts stitches. THROUGH THE LENS: the gash spreads easily, soft, bloodles
No clotting or gathering of pus.  No healing at all.
What?
When this cut was made, this person was already dead. (stands straight)
This is not Lady Van Tassel.
Young Masbath enters.  The door swings shut.
Katrina. (steps forward)
Is anyone here? Behind him, the door SLAMS open -- Lady Van Tassel reache grab Young Masbath by the throat.
Ichabod charges up to the church doors, pounding.
Open the door.  Open up, damn it! (pounds, shouting)
Lady van Tassel is alive.  The Horseman is her puppet.  Please...  The door opens and Huge Farmer points a rifle at Ichabod. Frightened people peer out from behind.
Aren't we rid of you?
Listen to me.  Lady Van Tassel has faked her death.  I need able men...
She's dead, and you have gone mad.
No...
(steps forward)

Get out!  Isn't it enough that you have ruined this town?  Go! Ichabod backs away from the gun, frustrated, runs... At the DOCTOR'S RESIDENCE, Van Ripper is still on the coa Ichabod sprints over, breathless, taking out his pistol.
Van Ripper... do you have a gun?
Yes.  Here... Van Ripper hold up a rifle.  Ichabod holds out his hand.
May I see it? Van Ripper's confused, but hands the rifle over.  Ichabod immediately points his pistol at Van Ripper.
Get down.  Hurry! Van Ripper climbs off.  Ichabod climbs up, whips the hors
Sorry. Van Ripper watches the coach leave, still with his hands

In a wooded area, Katrina lies unconscious.  Gloved hands reach to her hair and cut off a clump with SCISSORS. A conjuring pile has been made, containing a small animal heart with an iron nail through it.  Katrina's hair is ad and the pile is lit to burn. Nearby, Young Masbath watches, on his belly with his hand tied behind his back. Lady Van Tassel whispers over the fire, her white horse t nearby.  She looks to Katrina, who stirs. Lady Van Tassel takes the Horseman's skull from a bag ove her shoulder, places the skull in the flames.  THUNDER is HEARD.  Lady Van Tassel looks up, smiles.

location: WESTERN WOODS, TREE OF THE DEAD

text: The wind tosses leaves in swirls.  The twisted tree opens wide, with a RUMBLE -- shafts of light shooting out.
Ichabod drives the coach hard ahead.
Katrina sits up, groggy.  Lady Van Tassel looks down at h
You... you are alive.
Am I?  Or, are you and Young Masbath dead along with me? Katrina sees Young Masbath, and beyond him, the dying fir
She commands the Horseman.
And, quite beautifully done, wouldn't you say?  It is almost over. THUNDER again.  Wind starts to pick up.
(of the wind)
He rides tonight.
Father saw you die.

He saw me thrown... saw the Horseman looming over me as I fled.  Things I wanted him to see.  But, as long as I govern the Horseman, he cannot harm me.  Baltus did not stay enough to see that.  He ran as a coward, unfettered by my fate.
Then, whose body was it... ?
The precious servant girl Sarah.  I killed her and kept her body hidden, till I needed it.  And, when I return to the Hollow tomorrow, my version of the truth will come to pass.  (faking meekness)

I mean, there I was that fateful day, following Baltus into the woods.  I did not know what he was up to... where he was going.  I worried for his safety. Katrina cautiously moves the hand she's supporting hersel with, feels a rock and clutches it.
Imagine my surprise, finding him on a liason with a common servant.  A girl who had apparently become his secret love.
No one will believe your lies, whore.
This whore will see your mouth shut forever very soon.  But... I am not going to kill you.  Not me... She picks up the Horseman's skull in her gloved hand.
He will have that honor.
The Horseman rides Daredevil, a freight train of molderin flesh, heading towards a chasm with no bridge. They reach it, galloping in mid-air to the other side.
Ichabod guides the coach into the Van Tassel orchard.
Lady Van Tassel admires the skull.
(mock sorrow)

Woe is me... that spying on my husband in his filthy indiscretion, I saw he and Sarah attacked by the Horseman. Oh pity me... so overcome was I that I wandered in the Western Woods... dazed... nearly blind from terror. Lady Van Tassel crouches, rubbing dirt on her face.
And, tomorrow is my grand performance, having barely survived the elements... (more emoting)

By sheer luck I found my way back to the Hollow.  But... what do I find here... ?  My dear, sweet step-daughter Katrina is dead.  Why has God forsaken her? Seeing that Lady Van Tassel lavish attention on Katrina, Masbath takes this opportunity to ease onto his knees.
(of herself, pleased)
No one will suspect this sad woman who has been through such an ordeal.  With only the empty solace of her money and land to comfort her.
Ichabod leaps from the coach, bounds up the porch.
Katrina!
ICHABOD is HEARD.  Lady Van Tassel turns, astonished.

Murderer! Katrina slings the rock -- strikes Lady Van Tassel in the head, a glancing blow that knocks her down.  Katrina runs Katrina grips Young Masbath, helping him up... But, Lady Van Tassel scrambles up, grabs Katrina and thro her back to the ground. Lady Van Tassel steps hard on Katrina's ankle, touches he forehead, bleeding, pissed.
You've been a naughty girl. Young Masbath leaps to action, charging head first -- sla into Lady Van Tassel, sends her backwards. Katrina runs and pulls Masbath up.  They flee.
Ichabod! Lady Van Tassel rolls, recovering, not very concerned.
Little bitch.
Ichabod comes out the open front doors... hearing... KATRINA (o.s.)  (far away)
Ichabod! Ichabod climbs back on the coach, taking off.
Katrina and Young Masbath run out from a line of trees.
Ichabod!
Here we are! BEHIND IN THE FOREST, Lady Van Tassel rides her white hor in no hurry.  Wind kicks hard.  HOOFBEATS are HEARD.

Run, Katrina!  Fast as your pretty legs will carry you.  It makes no difference. ON THE LAWN, Ichabod drives towards Katrina and Masbath. Behind, at the tree line, Lady Van Tassel holds up the Horseman's skull, wind tossing her dress and hair.
Nothing will stop him now! At mid-field, Ichabod reaches Katrina and Masbath.
Climb up!
Lady Van Tassel...
I know.  Hold on. With Katrina and Masbath on board, Ichabod turns the coac Katrina unties Masbath's hands.  HOOFBEATS GET LOUDER.
Olly-olly oxen-free! Ichabod looks back towards Lady Van Tassel. At the treeline, the Horseman breaks into the open, hell horseback.  Full speed ahead.
Christ.
The coach hits the long straight road, away from the hous Katrina and Masbath hold on as the coach shakes violently
Where are we going?
I do not know.  Away.
Here he comes! Behind, the Horseman can be seen on the forest bordered r Closing fast.  Breakneck pace.
We might make it to the church. Masbath takes a lantern, crawls back to the roof.
Masbath... ! He ignores, reaching the rear of the coach and throwing t lantern at the Horseman.  It smashes on the trail.
Damn it, boy, get back here! Young Masbath slides back.  Katrina helps him.
What can we do?
Take the reins. Young Masbath takes them.  Ichabod slings Van Ripper's ri over his shoulder and starts back.  Katrina grips him.

Masbath is right.  We must do something. She releases.  Ichabod gets to the luggage area at the re struggling to open a storage box. Behind, the Horseman draws his sword, closer. Ichabod opens the box, hefting out a long, jagged SAW.

Ichabod! Ichabod looks.  The Horseman rides up, swinging... Ichabod recoils -- THWACK -- just missed by sword. The Horseman lets the coach get ahead, shifting to the other side of the trail... coming along side. Ichabod backpedals, looking to Masbath.

Keep him off!  Block him! Masbath guides the horses over.  The Horseman must fall behind to avoid the wheels. The coach hits a large, fallen tree trunk. Ichabod bounces, falling... He hangs off the side of the coach. Katrina climbs to offer her hand.  Ichabod offers the saw

Take it! Katrina takes the saw.  Now with both hands, Ichabod trie for better purchase.  He grips the coach door.  It opens. Ichabod clings to the open door as branches slam him. He's reaching to the coach threshold, reaching... Ichabod pulls himself inside. BOOM -- the door hits a tree trunk, bashed to pieces. Ichabod looks out from the coach, dazed.  He climbs. Katrina looks back as Young Masbath guides the coach to b the Horseman again. The Horseman sheaths his sword, riding... reaching to gri the back corner of the coach. The Horseman dismounts, clinging, climbing... Ichabod takes the rifle off his shoulder, aiming... BANG! -- splattering the Horseman's hand point blank.  Th Horseman hangs on with his other hand. The Horseman re-grips with the blasted hand, amazing sinc it's now all mush and bone. Ichabod throws the rifle on his way to the driver's perch taking the saw from Katrina.
Move forward! Katrina looks to the horses, then at Ichabod.
Go! Ichabod takes the reins from Young Masbath.

Help her. Reins in one hand and saw in the other, Ichabod waits.  T Horseman rises up and moves in, taking out his sword. Young Masbath climbs down to the wooden pole connecting t coach to the bridles, puts out his hand.  Katrina takes i Behind, the Horseman swings.  Ichabod blocks with the saw Young Masbath guides Katrina as she leaps onto one horse. Bareback.  Young Masbath straddles the horse beside her. The Horseman swings, backhanded knocks the sword from Ichabod's hand as Ichabod falls back... Ichabod hits the bridle post, hanging onto straps for dea life.  His feet drag on the trail. Above, the Horseman comes to the driver's perch, close en to kill Katrina.  He raises his sword... Katrina screams, ducking, helpless... Below, Ichabod pulls a bolt from the coach's hitching-rod He shoves off with his feet. The Horseman swings.... missing. The horses detach from the coach, dragging Ichabod along. The coach careens out of control. It flies off the trail, hits an incline and sails off, throwing the Horseman. The coach hits a tree trunk and SMASHES. FURTHER DOWN THE TRAIL, the coach horses stop.  Young Mas and Katrina climb off as Ichabod gets to his feet, hurtin clutching his previously wounded shoulder.
What now?
I doubt that's the end.
The church.
He moves too fast. Ichabod unhooks a lantern off the bridle rail.  The trail behind is silent, till a bone chilling SCREECH is HEARD.
What was that?
His horse. They start moving.  Ichabod looks around.  He sees...
There... Through the tree line, the Hollow's massive windmill can seen against the sky.  Katrina and Young Masbath run.

Ichabod, Katrina and Young Masbath book into this open ar heading to the windmill.  Another HORRIBLE SQUEAL echoes. Ichabod looks over his shoulder. Heavy, low hanging BRANCHES and VINES at the forest edge creep to life, parting... forming a sort of black tunnel.
He's coming! The Horseman gallops out, throwing leaves in his wake.

Hurry! The Horseman readies a battle axe. Ichabod gets under the windmill, helping Young Masbath up ladder and in.  Katrina next. The Horseman is almost there. Ichabod follows Katrina.  He gets in, feet dangling.  The Horseman dismounts...
Ichabod leaps up and struggles with the heavy trap door.. slams it.  He closes the latch just as the Horseman hits. The door buckles.

It won't hold. Ichabod goes to a large GRINDSTONE against a wall.  He struggles to roll it. Young Masbath helps him roll it to the trap door.  It fal on top with a thud.  The Horseman's sword jabs up through grindstone's center hole. The sword withdraws.  A POUNDING begins.
The Horseman chops at the door with his axe.

POUNDING CONTINUES.  The grindstone shifts.  Katrina and Young Masbath back away.  Ichabod holds his lantern up, desperate for ideas, searching. Above, to the right, is the milling platform, where grain ground and bagged.  To the left is the crooked staircase. Ichabod picks up a bailing hook, a plan forming.  He give his lantern to Katrina and points.

Get up those stairs.  Open the door to the roof and wait. Katrina and Young Masbath obey.  Ichabod crosses and clim the ladder to the milling platform.  He grasps a wooden lever, pulling it.  Gears above begin to turn.
The windmill's rotors CREAK to life, spinning. UNDER THE WINDMILL, the Horseman keeps chopping.  His axe exposes grindstone, throwing sparks.
Katrina looks down from the stairs. The Horseman's axe pries at the seam of the trap door.
Ichabod...
Keep climbing.  I will follow... Ichabod pulls bags of grain, lining them up at the edge o the milling platform.
(under his breath)

Hopefully. ABOVE, Young Masbath reaches the ceiling, throws open the door to the roof. BELOW, Ichabod cuts holes into the grain bags, so milled grain spills out and falls to the floor, creating dust. He grabs one open bag and dumps it.  More grain dust.
Masbath and Katrina come out.  Rotors spin behind them.

Ichabod sees below... the Horseman sticks a hand through, trying to push the grindstone aside, then withdrawing.  T RACKING axe continues.  Won't be long. Ichabod grabs one half-full bag of grain, swings it with effort, throws... The bag smashes on the grindstone, busting the door...
The grindstone falls through, SLAMMING the Horseman down.
Ichabod slices into a sack hanging from a pulley system. More and more dust rises. Below, the Horseman enters.  Katrina shouts from above.

Look out! The Horseman moves toward the ladder milling platform lad but Ichabod grabs it, pulling it up... The Horseman just misses the final rung. Ichabod throws the ladder aside as the Horseman backs off Ichabod looks to the staircase.  No way to climb down fro the milling platform and get there. The Horseman runs and leaps, grabbing a hanging chain... The Horseman climbs the chain, swinging... Ichabod runs across the platform, jumps... Ichabod grasps the frail rail of the staircase, barely. The rail creaks, about to break.  Behind, the Horseman la on the milling platform. Ichabod is losing grip.  Young Masbath races down the sta grabs his hand.  He pulls Ichabod up. Ichabod's pistol slips from its holster and falls. Ichabod and Young Masbath look... The Horseman, following Ichabod's lead, runs across the milling platform and leaps... Grabs the staircase rail, only a few feet from Ichabod an Masbath.  Ichabod kicks the rail, breaking it... The Horseman falls in billowing dust, crashing below. Ichabod pushes Masbath up the stairs.
Katrina helps them onto the roof.
Quickly, close it.
No. (takes lantern, points)
Get to the crest of the roof and be ready to jump.
Jump?  Jump where?
The Horseman runs, agile, up stairs.
Ichabod shepherds Katrina and Young Masbath to the edge w the rotors spin close.
The blades will carry us to the ground. Face front and wait for me.
I... I can't do this.
We have no choice. Ichabod moves back to the trap door. Katrina and Young Masbath look at the rotors, and down at long distance between them and the ground.
Be ready... Ichabod throws the lantern into the windmill and runs.
Now!
The Horseman continues up.  The lantern falls past.
Young Masbath jumps.  Ichabod grips Katrina and jumps... They hit one rotor and cling to the frame and cloth.  The rotor begins its downwards swing.
The lantern hits the ground and shatters.  FLAMES EXPLODE Grain dust is consumed instantaneously -- FLAMES ROAR upwards, filling the windmill... Engulfing the Horseman.

The rotor is halfway to its lowest point.  Masbath, Katri and Ichabod hang on as the entire structure trembles. BOOM -- flames shoot out the windows, doors and seams, lighting up the night. On the rattling rotor, Ichabod struggles to hold the fram with one hand and keep a grip on Katrina. Masbath drops.  Ichabod releases Katrina, then drops. They hit the ground.  Ichabod rolls, gasping, holding his shoulder.  They all look at each other in disbelief a mom Ichabod lets out a sort of rasping laugh, standing.

Okay... come on... Ichabod ushers them across the field, uphill.  Running. Lightning flashes across the sky.  THUNDER RUMBLES. A bolt strikes the windmill, and it EXPLODES... SHOCKWAVE DEAFENING.  The rotors bust apart.  Splinters o burning wood spin all directions. ACROSS THE FIELD, Ichabod, Katrina and Young Masbath keep running.  There is a WOODEN CART parked ahead. IN THE WINDMILL RUBBLE, the Horseman rises, shoving off burning debris.  His flame-ravaged uniform smolders. ACROSS THE FIELD, Ichabod stumbles onwards, but notices something horrible... In the distance, Lady Van Tassel's white horse roams free
(as this registers)

Oh, no... Young Masbath and Katrina are just past the cart when Lad Van Tassel rises from behind it, swings a plank... SLAMS Ichabod in the chest and sends him down. Lady Van Tassel grabs Katrina's hair, drags her.
Should have stayed away, Constable. Ichabod gets up slow, furious, reaches to his holster, on to find it empty.  He moves forward.
Keep back, or I kill her. She takes out scissors, holds them to Katrina's neck. Katrina ceases struggling. Ichabod keeps Masbath behind him, keeps his distance.  La Van Tassel shoots a glance...
See him... Par off, the Horseman strides from the wreckage.
You cannot kill what is already dead.
Let her go!
Yes... yes.  I think I will... Lady Van Tassel spins and throws Katrina in the cart, sho against it.

No! The cart rolls downhill.  Ichabod moves forward. Lady Van Tassel turns, brandishing the scissors, slashing missing.  Ichabod backs off. DOWNHILL, the cart picks up speed, headed for the Horsema The Horseman starts running to meet it. UPHILL, Lady Van Tassel grins.

Say goodbye to her. Lady Van Tassel lunges, stabbing.  Ichabod avoids, puts a his fury behind his fist -- punches her in the face. Lady Van Tassel hits the ground and her bag falls open, sending the Horseman's skull rolling out... The skull rolls... rolls... landing far away. DOWNHILL, Katrina leaps out from the cart... She lands hard... The Horseman shoves the empty cart aside, still on the mo UPHILL, Ichabod sees the skull.  He runs towards it. Lady van Tassel grabs Ichabod by the ankle.  He falls. DOWNHILL, Katrina runs back.  The Horseman is catching up UPHILL, Ichabod tries to pull f ree from Lady Van Tassel. Young Masbath comes behind her - BAM - hits her in the he with the wooden plank.  She's out. Ichabod scrambles to his feet. DOWNHILL, the Horseman catches Katrina, taking her by the hair as she falls to her knees and screams. UPHILL, Ichabod runs... grasps the Horseman's skull. He runs towards the Horseman and Katrina. DOWNHILL, Katrina struggles, but the Horseman holds her r by her hair... raises his sword... UPHILL, Ichabod throws the skull...

Horseman! The skull spins through the air... The Horseman drops Katrina, reaches up... Catches the skull. Katrina runs. Ichabod runs to meet her, grabs her as she falls, exhaust Together, they back away from the Horseman. The Horseman holds the skull out, then brings it to his shoulders, to its rightful place.  THUNDER POUNDS. TRANSFORMATION begins -- blood and flesh rise up from the Horseman's throat and grip the skull. Young Masbath drops the plank, watching in awe. The Horseman's reformation continues.  Muscle forms.  Liq become solids.  He is made whole once more, the same evil human face we saw in Baltus' stories. He looks to Ichabod and Katrina, touches his restored fac Daredevil rides up, SCREECHING.  The Horseman replaces hi sward and climbs into the saddle. He rides towards Katrina and Ichabod, but passes them by. They are so exhausted they fall down. Young Masbath backs up as the Horseman comes, but the Horseman does not want him either. The Horseman leans to grab Lady Van Tassel's unconscious form, pulls her up across Daredevil's back. He rides away with her. Ichabod and Katrina watch him go.  They look at each othe then kiss gratefully. Ichabod looks to Young Masbath.
How are you?
Tired. Ichabod smiles and holds out his arm.  Masbath comes over Group hug.  Lightning brightens the farmland around them.

HOOFBEATS.  The Horseman enters the clearing, keeping a h on Lady Van Tassel.  Ahead, the twisted tree awaits. Lady Van Tassel is awakening, face bloody.  She turns her head and looks forward.  She screams. The twisted tree's wound opens, wide and glowing. Daredevil picks up speed... Daredevil leaps just as a lightning bolt blasts down, striking the Horseman. For an instant, Horseman and horse are transformed, SKELE OF LIGHT, entering the tree. Silence and smoke.  At the tree, Lady Van Tassel's hand sticks out from the tight-shut suture. The sewn wound on her palm seeps blood.

location: NEW YORK CITY STREET, ICHABOD'S HOME

text: A bright, busy day in New York.  A coach pulls up to Ichabod's home.  Ichabod is the driver.  He gets off, goe and opens the coach door.  He helps Katrina down.  Next, Young Masbath sticks his head out. Ichabod goes about unloading bags.  Katrina holds Young Masbath's hand, and they look down the street in wonder.
